benefits:
• whey
  • tray

features.name: Traceability
features.body: Cages are typically sized to hold one vat to maintain vat identity throughout the brining process. This provides you with the ability to collect and record cheese data for improved quality control.

features.name: Brine circulation system
features.body: The brine level is constant and the perforated cages ensure maximum circulation throughout the system. And as the brine is continuously cleaned, chilled and circulated, it doesn’t have to be replaced. That means there is no emptying into floor drains. Furthermore, an automated brine maker maintains precise salt levels.

features.name: Whey Tray
features.body: Pressing whey is collected in a tray. The tray is emptied and cleaned after every pressing cycle. This principle ensures high quality whey production during a full production run

features.name: Low cycle speed
features.body: For high capacity lines two moulds can be positioned in one tray which reduces the cycle speed of the line. A slower gentler speed reduces the wear and tear and risks for disturbances

name: Tetra Pak Whey Tray System

options.name: Adaptable layout
options.body: The size of the brining system is designed to suit your product and production capacity. The layout of the brining system can be adapted to fit the available space in your plant.

benefits:
• Handles curd gently, minimizing fat and fines loss, and maximizing yield
  • Flexibility to produce all recipes
  • Proven durability, based on decades of engineering experience

features.name: Tipping weirs
features.header: Minimizes losses of fat and fines
features.body: Curd is fed gently from the in-feed header system, via two inlets, into the tipping weir. From there, it flows evenly across the full width of the screen. This gentle process and even distribution contribute to minimizing losses of fat and fines. The weir can be programmed to empty periodically, ensuring that curd is completely cleared at user-specified intervals.

features.name: Fines-reduction belt
features.header: Reduces losses, maintenance and facilitates cleaning
features.body: The machine’s self-tensioning, self-tracking belt consists of a series of moulded polypropylene sections that are linked together with plastic pins. The flat rigid surface of the belt allows for agitation of the cheese, while generating minimal fines. The polypropylene material prevents curd from sticking to the belt surface, and enables fast and easy cleaning.

features.name: Wedge wire screen
features.body: The wires on this screen have a specially designed triangular cross-section, which removes the maximum amount of whey, while allowing the curd to pass. It separates the whey so efficiently that the curd is almost fully de-wheyed before reaching the bottom of the screen.

features.name: CIP isolation
features.header: Maximize production with shorter cleaning time
features.body: To maximize production during CIP, the machine can be configured with a CIP isolation device, allowing production to continue on the lower belt while washing the upper belt.

name: Tetra Pak® Draining Matting machine 2

options.name: Fines recovery system
options.body: With this option, the whey is recirculated through a second, finer wedge wire screen. This operation effectively recovers almost all of the remaining fines, further increasing yield.

options.name: Dual outlet
options.body: With this optional dual hygienic auger, you can divert the cheese into multiple downstream lines - the ultimate in plant flexibility.

benefits:
• Superior cooling – achieves desired final core temperature faster
  • Optimal use of floor space, as brine tank goes into the floor
  • Reduced brine time, maximum salt absorption and gentle handling of cheese blocks

features.name: Brine circulation system
features.body: The brine level is constant and the perforated cages ensure maximum circulation throughout the system. And as the brine is continuously cleaned, chilled and circulated, it doesn’t have to be replaced. That means there is no emptying into floor drains. Furthermore, an automated brine maker maintains precise salt levels.

features.name: Cooling
features.body: As the cheese is fully submerged into the cold brine, all sides of the cheese are equally brined and chilled. Continuous bottom to top brine flow provides constant exposure to chilled full-strength brine. High brine turnover rate produces consistent brine temperature throughout the system.

features.name: Block size flexibility
features.header: Designed for a variety of sizes
features.body: The system is designed to preserve excellent block shape and handle a variety of cheese sizes. These include Euroblock (500x300 mm), provolone (varies), 2.5kg (90mmx90mmx271mm) , 6 lb.(4in X 4in x 11in), 20 lb. (3.75in x 7in x 21in) , wheels, big block Swiss and various specialties.

features.name: Adaptable layout
features.body: The size of the brining system is designed to suit your product and production capacity. The layout of the brining system can be adapted to fit the available space in your plant.

features.name: Traceability
features.body: Cages are typically sized to hold one vat to maintain vat identity throughout the brining process. This provides you with the ability to collect and record cheese data for improved quality control.

name: Tetra Pak® Brining system S

benefits:
• A-quality whey production, maximizing the profitability of the pressing process
  • Increased sustainability; minimize chemicals, energy and waste
  • Efficient, gentle pressing of semi hard cheese; the ideal solution for high capacity lines

features.name: Whey Tray
features.body: Pressing whey is collected in a tray. The tray is emptied and cleaned after every pressing cycle. This principle ensures high quality whey production during a full production run

features.name: CIP requirements
features.body:
The moulds are positioned in trays. The presses will remain free from whey and curd particles during the full production.

Since the moulds are positioned in trays limited CIP cleaning is required.

features.name: Open presses
features.body: The tray concept is equipped with open presses and enables easy access and maintenance

features.name: Low cycle speed
features.body: For high capacity lines two moulds can be positioned in one tray which reduces the cycle speed of the line. A slower gentler speed reduces the wear and tear and risks for disturbances

features.name: Adaptable layout
features.header: Dedicated solution for the individual plant
features.body: The size of the Whey Tray system can be aligned and adapted to suit your today and future capacity requirements as well as the type and cheese formats. The layout of the Whey Tray system can be adapted to fit the available space in your building.

features.name: Triple level rinsing unit
features.header: Ensures efficient cleaning of moulds, lids and trays
features.body: The rinsing machine has a compact design which enables to clean moulds, lids and trays simultaneously. The moulds, lids and trays are conveyed on three levels in height through the rinsing machine. The rinsing machine consists of four sections: pre-rinse, main rinse and two post rinse sections for effective and efficient cleaning. The rinsing water for the post rinse is reused after use in the pre rinse section.

name: Tetra Pak Whey Tray system
header: Efficient pressing and high-quality whey production

benefits: This unit leverages advanced aseptic tank technology to secure proven and safe aseptic in-line blending and allows the blending point to be placed further downstream on the aseptic side.
name: Tetra Pak® Aseptic Tank LV combined with aseptic blending function

benefits: Tetra Pak® Water Treatment unit FUV treats water by the means of filtration and UV light to create commercial sterile water as ingredient for the best-practice line for JNSD with aseptic blending. It is not a standalone product.
name: Tetra Pak® Water Treatment unit FUV

benefits:
• System is closed and the process is automated – this creates better hygiene, as there is no manual contact with product
  • Higher yield – ultrafiltration uses less milk than traditional cheesemaking, as the high-nutrition whey proteins are retained in cheese
  • Consistent product quality and easy to control parameters and composition
name: Ultrafiltration unit SW

benefits:
• Continuous feeding of filling machine guaranteed by two GDL mixing tanks that are queued during emptying – when the active tank reaches low level, the new batch pushes the previous
  • The special design of agitators and cones improve hygiene by eliminating GDL residues
  • Integrated system for rennet preparation and inline dosing, where continuous dosing is done just before the filling machine and quantity is based on product flow.
name: Tetra Pak® GDL and Rennet Dosing unit
header: Making white cheese production more effective

benefits:
• Rennet is dosed inline, just before the filling machine
  • Rennet quantity is based on product flow and dosing speed is controlled
  • Compact design provides easy access during production and maintenance
name: White Cheese Rennet Dosing unit

benefits:
• Enables dosing of dry salt to the storage tanks, where it is mixed with cheese mass
  • Dry salt is added into the storage tank by air – with a salt blower – and salt transfer speed is adjustable
  • A stand-alone unit that is easy to operate
name: Tetra Pak® White Cheese Salt Dosing unit

benefits: Customized design to enable optimal conditions for fermentation of milk and buffering of yoghurt.
name: Fermentation tank

benefits:
• High flexibility in products and capacity range​
  • Discharge feature​
  • Simple nozzle design

features.name: Unique Nozzle design
features.header: Enables flexibility and low energy consumption
features.body: The bowl of the Tetra Pak® Separator Q517 has twelve nozzles located on the outer periphery. The product is ejected in an angle to minimize energy losses. The selection of nozzle sizes depends on the desired end product composition and capacity. Nozzle size flexibility enables the separator to be customized for a variety of product requirements.

features.name: Efficient discharges
features.body: The discharge function enables the nozzles to be cleared of product without dismantling the machine. Such self-cleaning machines are less sensitive to product variations and the discharging feature ensures efficient cleaning in place (CIP).

features.name: Sterile air
features.body: Sterile air can be supplied to the space around the bowl to ensure high product quality.

name: Tetra Pak® Separator Q517

benefits:
• Every detail of the machine from first inlet screen to cutting is optimized to give a consistent end product.
  • Smart features like the whey screen and perforated draining belt ensure a high yield with minimal curd losses
  • Hygiene is ensured by features like pyramid shaped sumps and strategically located cleaning devices

features.name: First inlet screen
features.body: There are 9 litres of whey for every litre of curd. Made of stainless steel wedge wire, the inlet screen has gaps of just 0.25 mm between each wedge. This means a high proportion of the liquid can drain through the holes, but very few curd particles pass through.

features.name: Channel design
features.body: Baffle plates are strategically placed in the channel, generating turbulence in the mixture and ensuring the curds are evenly distributed across the width of the belt. This gives an even process throughout the mixture, and leads to a more consistent end product.

features.name: Draining belt with tapered perforations
features.header: High hygiene and minimal fines losses
features.body: The draining belt has tapered slots through which the curd particles pass. Once they have passed through the narrowest point – the inlet - the curd particles can fall through the wider part of the hole easily, without the risk of clogging.

features.name: Draining boosting stirrer
features.body: If pockets of whey accumulate on top of the curd mat, they simply remain there, leading to an uneven moisture distribution. This stirrer eliminates this problem by breaking up the curd mat so the whey can drain off through the perforated belt.

features.name: Fish bone belt support
features.body: The belt support has an open fish bone design which delivers a number of benefits. The most important one is that it reduces the level of friction between the belt and the support, so the belt can run smoothly without jumping. It gives an even wear across the belt, and does not leave black wear marks (that can occur when parallel support is used). Finally, it’s much easier to clean than a closed design since there are no CIP blind spots.

name: Tetra Pak® Cheddaring machine 2200 series

options.name: Second whey screen
options.header: Catches the curd particles, maximizing yield
options.body: Any rogue curd particles that have not been caught by the first inlet screen, are caught in this, the second whey screen. All the whey that passes through the screen is immediately collected before it has had time to accumulate bacteria – so it can be categorized as ‘high-quality whey’.

header: For efficient production of pasta filata

benefits:
• Gives you the highest yield of any vat on the market
  • At 38,555 kg (or 85,000 lb) this is the largest cheese vat available
  • Durable, based on decades of engineering experience

features.name: Dual counter-rotating agitators
features.header: Optimal curd creation, cutting and pump-out
features.body: Counter rotating agitators achieve optimal mixing, which reduces rennet mixing time and makes it possible to predict the correct time for cutting. Optimal mixing also eliminates swirl in the vat, which reduces cutting time, gives a more consistent curd size, lower fat loss, and reduced fine creation. Finally, uniform mixing enables more consistent down-stream processing in belt machines.

features.name: Hot water heat transfer
features.body: We offer a choice of steam or hot water heat transfer. In our premium hot water vat, heat is transferred by a custom-engineered heat exchanger integrated into the vat wall. Unlike some laminar flow systems, this method effectively utilizes all the available surface area, providing gentle heating - without the risk of overheating and subsequent fat losses.

features.name: Patented seal design
features.header: Lowest maintenance of any cheese vat
features.body: Our unique seal has been proven in hundreds of machines and over millions of hours of equipment operation. When properly maintained, its superior design eliminates leaks. A leak detection port gives advance warning if maintenance is needed. While one side of the agitator contains a seal, the other is supported with a USDA-accepted internal bearing design – which can be inspected from the outside the vat.

features.name: Vat design
features.body: Every aspect of the vat is designed to maximize yield in relation to floor space. The dual barrel main body allows for a high production volume. A slope-to-centre drain enables a wide variety of piping layouts, making it possible to optimize layout in new plants and adding flexibility to existing plants. The drain is positioned to save as much of the precious curd as possible during the final rinse-out. Finally, thanks to their small surface area the blades also help minimize losses.

name: Tetra Pak® Cheese Vat Yieldmaster 2

options.name: Coagulation sensor
options.body: The sensor contains an infrared light which detects when coagulation has begun. Based on this data, it calculates when cutting should start – leading to a more accurate and reliable result than is possible with manual control. If for some reason the milk is not coagulating properly, the sensor alerts the control panel, greatly reducing the downtime associated with this type of deviation.

benefits:
• Handles curd gently, minimizing fat and fines loss, and maximizing yield
  • Industry-leading design optimizes use of space in your plant
  • Proven durability, based on decades of engineering experience

features.name: Dual counter-rotating agitators
features.header: Optimal curd creation, cutting and pump-out
features.body: Counter rotating agitators achieve optimal mixing, which reduces rennet mixing time and makes it possible to predict the correct time for cutting. Optimal mixing also eliminates swirl in the vat, which reduces cutting time, gives a more consistent curd size, lower fat loss, and reduced fine creation. Finally, uniform mixing enables more consistent down-stream processing in belt machines.

features.name: Hot water heat transfer
features.body: We offer a choice of steam or hot water heat transfer. In our premium hot water vat, heat is transferred by a custom-engineered heat exchanger integrated into the vat wall. Unlike some laminar flow systems, this method effectively utilizes all the available surface area, providing gentle heating - without the risk of overheating and subsequent fat losses.

features.name: Patented seal design
features.header: Lowest maintenance of any cheese vat
features.body: Our unique seal has been proven in hundreds of machines and over millions of hours of equipment operation. When properly maintained, its superior design eliminates leaks. A leak detection port gives advance warning if maintenance is needed. While one side of the agitator contains a seal, the other is supported with a USDA-accepted internal bearing design – which can be inspected from the outside the vat.

features.name: Vat body
features.body: The vat is designed to utilize the space in your plant effectively. Compared to round vat bodies, its design means the dual agitators can have a relatively smaller diameter, leading to lower centripetal speed at the blade tip. And this, in turn, means less yield-robbing energy going into the curd – and consequently higher yields.

name: Tetra Pak® Cheese Vat HCV-S & HCV-H

options.name: Top mounted predraw
options.body: This option uses an adjustable sieve to remove whey from the vat, preventing it from recombining in the vat. During whey removal, the liquid level in the vat is automatically measured and the sieve follows the liquid level to a pre-set end point which, additionally, prevents fouling of the intake screen

options.name: Coagulation sensor
options.body: The sensor contains an infrared light which detects when coagulation has begun. Based on this data, it calculates when cutting should start – leading to a more accurate and reliable result than is possible with manual control. If for some reason the milk is not coagulating properly, the sensor alerts the control panel, greatly reducing the downtime associated with this type of deviation.

options.name: Tetra Pak® Yieldmaster Vat blades
options.body: To further increase cheese yields, we offer these superior vat blades as an option on the Tetra Pak® Cheese Vat HCV-S & HCV-H. They were originally designed for our premium Tetra Pak® Yieldmaster cheese vat 2, but on popular request, can now also be installed in this unit too.

benefits:
• Low production costs, enabled by highly efficient process and optimal yield on ingredients
  • Complete control over quality parameters, thanks to a unique two-step emulsification process and prediction tool

  • Unlimited flexibility to produce everything from emulsified sauces to spreads made from beans and vegetables. Easy to scale up.

features.name: Prediction tool
features.header: Ensure identical or enhanced product quality
features.body: Our prediction tool enables the replication and/or enhancement of any cold emulsion products. With an existing recipe as the starting point, it measures the size and distribution of droplets and generates the exact process parameters required to replicate it i.e. mixing time, speed and shear force. Just bring your sample to our Product Development Centre and we’ll tell (and/or show) you how to make it on our high shear mixer.

features.name: Dynamic HS mixing head
features.header: Full control over product quality parameters
features.body: Our patented technology allows high and low shear mixing in the same process. It gives you complete control over the speed, time and degree of shear force of your mixing. This means you can fine-tune the size and distribution of droplets in your product, and hence achieve the exact viscosity, mouthfeel and texture you want.

features.name: Double-shaft agitator
features.body: In this unit, a double-shaft agitator circulates product around the tank. Its counter rotating blades reach every corner of the tank, ensuring that all product passes evenly through the Dynamic HS mixing head, resulting in a homogenous end product regardless of viscosity.

features.name: Unique mixer design
features.header: Ingredient introduction 4 – 5 times faster than standard equipment
features.body: In this high shear mixer, the ingredients are introduced into the main body of the mixing vessel, rather than being fed directly into the high shear mixing head. This means there is no risk of over-shearing and the speed of ingredient introduction can be significantly higher than traditional mayonnaise production equipment.

features.name: Vacuum system
features.header: For rapid ingredient introduction and product deaeration
features.body: Ingredients are rapidly drawn into the mixing vessel by an independently controlled vacuum pump. This enables faster, more complete deaeration of the product and allows full control of the vacuum level inside the mixer.

name: Tetra Pak® High Shear Mixer for emulsified sauces and spreads

options.name: Multi-stage mixing head
options.body: In a batch plus set-up, a patented rotor stator inline mixing head is placed on the outlet string of the mixer – for creating the final emulsion. It combines the emulsification process with emptying, thereby shortening production time. Its mechanical design is hydro-dynamically balanced to allow very high speeds and narrow tolerances.

options.name: Twin-screw pump
options.body: In a batch plus set-up, this pump controls the flow of product from the mixing vessel into an inline multi-stage HS mixing head – creating the final emulsion. It can handle both low and high viscosity products, and works under extremely low suction pressures without risk for cavitation.

options.name: Control of ingredient inlet and product outlet
options.body: To produce mayonnaise continuously with a batch plus setup, it is possible to add control valves and flowmeters on all ingredient inlets and the product outlet. This increases capacity and further reduces the production cost per kilo of product.

options.name: Bin lifter
options.body: The bin lifter system is capable of lifting bins of 200 litres or 300 litres with the press of a button. The contents of the bin can be emptied automatically into the mixing tank through a large manway at the top. This provides a sanitary and ergonomic way to add ingredients such as beans, chickpeas and other vegetables.

options.name: Pressure Vessel
options.body: By choosing a pressure vessel for the mixing tank, customers have the option of cooking under pressure at 3 bars giving temperatures of up to 135°C. Apart from giving an even shorter cooking time, this form of cooking can give other benefits such as preserving colour and taste.

options.name: Direct Steam Injection
options.body: If you want to heat up the contents of the mixer fast, there is the option of direct steam injection. We have developed our own design of nozzles to ensure a long working life. A sanitary steam system is used to ensure food safety.

options.name: Vibrating powder hopper
options.header: Reduces air incorporation; enhances product quality
options.body: In a batch or batch plus set-up where powdered ingredients are used, our patented vibrating powder hopper compresses the powder, preventing the formation of so-called ‘rat holes’. This significantly reduces the amount of air introduced along with the powder.

benefits:
• Product consistency thanks to accurate salt delivery
  • Pneumatic conveying system means it can accommodate most plant layouts
  • Proven durability, based on decades of engineering experience

features.name: Lost weight feeder
features.body: To ensure salt delivery accuracy each individual salting application line has a dedicated salt hopper and feeder. The hopper and feeder are mounted on loadcells which are used to measure the lost weight of the hopper. This system ensures an accurate salt feed rate and enables the machine to account for variations in particle size and density. With a dedicated salt transfer blower, each individual salt application can operate independently to support any process recipe.

features.name: Pneumatic Salt Conveyor
features.body: Each salt application is metered into a dedicated pneumatic conveyor which provides the optimum in flexibility of salt delivery in your plant. The conveyor design is based on extensive salt conveying experience, ensuring consistent salt delivery and the integrity of the salt as it is delivered to your product.

features.name: Rare earth magnet
features.body: To eliminate potential ferrous contaminates from the salt supply, the Tetra Pak® Salt-Dispenser 2 incorporates rare earth magnets after each salt feeder, just prior to entry into the pneumatic conveying line. Magnets can also be placed at the exit of the bulk salt hopper at customer request.

features.name: Quality of materials
features.body: Powdered salt can create a highly corrosive environment for equipment. With high grade stainless steel throughout, and fiberglass hoppers to minimize corrosion and abrasion resistance, this machine has been optimized through decades of experience to ensure a long service life and to meet your demands for durability and reliability.

name: Tetra Pak®  Salt-Dispenser 2

options.name: Ingredient addition
options.body: This option provides the ability to add other powdered ingredients to the end product through their own dedicated lines, or in combination with one of the salt application lines.

options.name: Bulk salt hopper
options.body: This optional bulk salt hopper system saves time as it assists in the manipulation and dumping of large salt bags into the bulk hopper. From there, the bulk hopper works together with the small station hoppers, automatically filling them when needed via the supplied salt auger. The bulk salt hopper can be mounted remotely or near the Tetra Pak® Salt-Dispenser 2, giving flexibility in the layout of your plant.

benefits:
• Three product choices – one simple foundation
  • Safe and easy operation
  • Standardized design gives value for money

features.name: Application-specific designs
features.header: Fit for purpose for milk, yoghurt or cream
features.body:
The unit has a brand new pasteurizer configuration with a simple design based on standardized building blocks. Though simple, it is built with integrated CIP and smart control. Standardized solutions give value for money and are simple to order. The pasteurizer is designed for dairy applications and offers the following capacities:

  • Milk and yoghurt milk pasteurization: 5,000 l/h or 10,000 l/h
  • Cream pasteurization: 2,500 l/h or 5,000 l/h

features.name: Full production overview
features.body: Advanced automated control ensures reliable results time after time. The heating unit is controlled and monitored from the large screen of the operator panel. Thanks to the automated system, all the operator needs to do is select the pre-set parameters and required functions. The unit will continuously log pasteurization temperature, flow and the position of the flow diversion valve. This logging system also stores useful production data for traceability purposes.

features.name: Pressure differential
features.body: A booster pump creates a differential pressure between the pasteurized and unpasteurized side of the unit to minimize the risk of contamination. To further enhance safety, this differential can be monitored by optional pressure transmitters. If these transmitters register that the differential has been lost, the product is automatically diverted back to the balance tank for recirculation.

features.name: Integrated CIP system
features.header: Spend more time producing and less time cleaning
features.body: The integrated CIP system is for cleaning the pasteurizer and connected sub-modules. The whole circuit is cleaned with one CIP program. Before the start of CIP, the inlet pipes for acid and caustic are manually connected to the balance tank for automated dosing of concentrate. During production runs, the same inlet pipes are manually connected to waste discharge to avoid mixture with products.

features.name: Compact yet service friendly design
features.header: Easy and safe to use and maintain
features.body: The unit is created with operators in mind, which makes it easy and safe to use and simple to maintain. The footprint has been minimized by integrating the holding cell neatly into the unit. Despite being compact, the design remains service-friendly with dedicated “step-in” areas at strategic points.

name: Tetra Pak® Pasteurizer D Base

options.name: Complete pasteurization line from Tetra Pak®
options.body: Create a flexible processing line for milk and cream pasteurization. The pasteurization unit is designed to efficiently work together with a separator, homogenizer and standardization unit from Tetra Pak®. To have a line where all parts fit together ensures robust separation, stable standardization, and homogenization with low maintenance and energy consumption. For processing of yoghurt milk, a spiral holding cell can also be included for a longer holding time. This will create a flexible processing line for milk and cream pasteurization.

header: Simple yet smart pasteurization for your daily dairy applications

benefits:
• Produce consistent high quality products thanks to gentle handling and even distribution
  • Get quick payback and big savings on ingredient, maintenance and investment costs
  • Secure food safety with hygienic design – 3A approved and designed according to EHEDG

features.name: Standardized frame
features.header: Easily upgrade from 2000 to 3000 model to increase capacity
features.body: The stainless steel frame with sloped surfaces and mounted on wheels is the same for both the 2000 and 3000 models. Only the hopper, the mixer and the pump need to be upgraded.

features.name: Hopper
features.body: Several smart features enable gentle handling of sensitive and brittle inclusions such as cookie pieces and fruit pieces. The agitator rotates and the auger is shaped to enable gradual filling and even takeout. This minimizes circulation inside the hopper and prevents clumps from forming. A grooved outlet pipe releases ingredients evenly into the product pump inlet funnel.

features.name: Hopper grid
features.header: Prevent accidents when filling ingredients into hopper
features.body: The hopper safety grid is designed according to the latest safety standards to secure operator safety. The holes in the grid are large enough for ingredients to be loaded in but narrow enough to protect operators.

features.name: Hopper lid
features.header: Enables easy access and flexible line layout
features.body: The hopper lid opens backwards, enabling ingredients to be added from the sides and front at a low re-feeding height. This provides easy access for operators to refill the hopper if required. Two dosers may be placed beside one another without obstructing the refill process.

features.name: Choice of augers
features.body: As the auger turns, the ingredients are transferred at a steady dosing rate from the hopper to the pump. This unit can be fitted with a variety of different augers, and they are easy to change. This means your dosing is always optimized for the product type, size and required capacity range.

features.name: Lamella pump
features.body: Ingredients are fed into the lamella pump and the cavities between the lamellas carry the inclusions into the pressurized product zone. The pump is designed to transfer the ingredients gently into the pressurized base product, without breaking or damaging them, and without incorporating any air into the mixture.

features.name: Compact design
features.body: Thanks to its small footprint (1.1 m2), the unit can be used in almost all production plants, even where space is limited.

features.name: Loss-in-weight control system
features.body: The loss-in-weight control system, combined with the correct auger selection, enables extremely accurate dosing – typically achieving a standard deviation dosing rate of less than 3%, depending on the size and type of inclusion.

name: Tetra Pak® Ingredient Doser A3

options.name: Ventilated lamellas
options.header: Enables a broad variety of large inclusions
options.body: The lamellas are designed with ventilation holes to ensure that all the air is released from large inclusions such as cookies, which may have a lot of trapped air inside them. When the pressurized base product meets the cavity, it naturally replaces any air that may be present between the inclusions, and that air then escapes through the ventilation holes.

options.name: Magnetic grid
options.body: Placed on top of the hopper, the magnetic grid is designed to trap any foreign objects made of metal, which may have found their way into the ingredients packages. Although this is a rare occurrence, an error can have dramatic consequences, so it is worth safeguarding your production with this simple option.

options.name: Insulated hopper
options.body: Soft inclusions such as fruit pieces often benefit from being injected cooled or pre-frozen. This not only maintains their natural shape, but also makes them easier to integrate into the ice cream – without causing it to melt.

options.name: Automatic CIP front cover
options.header: Minimizes the risk of damage to the pump
options.body: For best results when cleaning, all the tight tolerances inside the lamella pump should be released to enable thorough flush through. This is achieved with an automatic CIP front cover inside the pump’s closed system. This type of cover also guarantees the right pressure during operation, and thereby reduces wear and tear of pump parts during both operation and cleaning.

options.name: Bridge breaker
options.header: Prevent product build-up on sides of inlet funnel
options.body: When dosing sticky and dusty ingredients there is risk of them building up on the sides of the funnel and this can make the dosing inefficient. The bridgebreaker is indexing up-and-down the sides, ensuring continuous movement to prevent anything from sticking to the funnel sides.

options.name: Auxiliary Doser
options.body: You can even add a Tetra Pak® Ingredient Doser A2000 or A3000 A3 unit to your setup, enabling you to feed two or more ingredients simultaneously. This includes a vibrating feed for nuts, almonds, etc.

header: Cost savings, best product quality and low investment

benefits:
• Produce consistently high quality products thanks to gentle handling and even distribution
  • Production method guarantees even distribution of added ingredients throughout the product
  • Handle a wide capacity range and easily upgrade from 2000 to 3000 model for future growth

features.name: Standardized frame
features.header: Easily upgrade from 2000 to 3000 model to increase capacity
features.body: The stainless steel frame with sloped surfaces and mounted on wheels is the same for both the 2000 and 3000 models. Only the hopper, the mixer and the pump need to be upgraded.

features.name: Hopper lid
features.header: Enables easy access and flexible line layout
features.body: The hopper lid opens backwards, enabling ingredients to be added from the sides and front at a low re-feeding height. This provides easy access for operators to refill the hopper if required. Two dosers may be placed beside one another without obstructing the refill process.

features.name: Choice of augers
features.body: As the auger turns, the ingredients are transferred at a steady dosing rate from the hopper to the pump. This unit can be fitted with a variety of different augers, and they are easy to change. This means your dosing is always optimized for the product type, size and required capacity range.

features.name: Lamella pump
features.body: Ingredients are fed into the lamella pump and the cavities between the lamellas carry the inclusions into the pressurized product zone. The pump is designed to transfer the ingredients gently into the pressurized base product, without breaking or damaging them, and without incorporating any air into the mixture.

features.name: Compact design
features.body: Thanks to its small footprint (1.1 m2), the unit can be used in almost all production plants, even where space is limited.

name: Tetra Pak® Ingredient Doser M3

options.name: Ventilated lamellas
options.header: Enables a broad variety of large inclusions
options.body: The lamellas are designed with ventilation holes to ensure that all the air is released from large inclusions such as cookies, which may have a lot of trapped air inside them. When the pressurized base product meets the cavity, it naturally replaces any air that may be present between the inclusions, and that air then escapes through the ventilation holes.

options.name: Magnetic grid
options.body: Placed on top of the hopper, the magnetic grid is designed to trap any foreign objects made of metal, which may have found their way into the ingredients packages. Although this is a rare occurrence, an error can have dramatic consequences, so it is worth safeguarding your production with this simple option.

options.name: Insulated hopper
options.body: Soft inclusions such as fruit pieces often benefit from being injected cooled or pre-frozen. This not only maintains their natural shape, but also makes them easier to integrate into the ice cream – without causing it to melt.

options.name: Automatic CIP front cover
options.header: Minimizes the risk of damage to the pump
options.body: For best results when cleaning, all the tight tolerances inside the lamella pump should be released to enable thorough flush through. This is achieved with an automatic CIP front cover inside the pump’s closed system. This type of cover also guarantees the right pressure during operation, and thereby reduces wear and tear of pump parts during both operation and cleaning.

benefits: Concentrates a yoghurt or a fermented cream cheese to achieve the desired composition and texture
name: Ultrafiltration unit

benefits:
• Flexibility to press cheeses of different shapes and sizes on the same equipment
  • Hygienic production environment - consistently high-quality product
  • Maximum uptime, thanks to shorter cleaning cycles

features.name: Multiple mould formats
features.body: If you have a filler upstream producing cheeses of different shapes and sizes, you need a flexible mould handling system. When switching between formats, the moulds in this unit are collected and placed in a storage unit. The line is prepared to handle multiple formats, so no other adaptations are needed.

features.name: Individual pressing
features.header: Full control over the pressing process
features.body: In this system, the pressing plates are activated by individual pneumatic cylinders. This means that each cheese receives the same pressing force, resulting in an even end product quality.

features.name: Enclosed presses
features.body: The presses are enclosed, which helps maintain a stable production environment with regard to temperature, moisture and hygiene. For cleaning, all the moulds are removed from the line and stored separately. The enclosed presses make it possible to employ efficient CIP cleaning – which maximizes uptime.

features.name: Dual-level cleaning tunnel
features.header: Ensures cleanliness of moulds and lids
features.body: The moulds and lids are conveyed into the cleaning unit after each use. The cleaning process begins with pre-rinsing, using water from the previous final rinsing. Main cleaning then takes place, maintaining a stable temperature and concentration of cleaning agents. The last step is final rinsing with fresh water, to ensure that all the detergent is removed. This water is then led back to the start of the cycle for use in the next pre-rinse – thereby reducing water consumption. The tunnel itself is cleaned after each production cycle. The capacity of the cleaning tunnel is adapted to match line capacity.

features.name: Mould storage unit
features.body: When the equipment needs to be cleaned or when different mould formats are being used, the moulds are removed and stored in this unit. Built on several levels, this storage unit makes efficient use of the space in your plant. And with one shelf per level, the moulds are kept safe.

name: Tetra Pak® Mould Handling system

benefits:
• Every detail of the design - from inlet screen to mellowing - is optimized to give a consistent end product
  • Smart features such as the perforated draining belt and whey screen design ensure a high yield with minimal curd losses
  • Hygiene is secured by e.g. pyramid shaped sumps and strategically located cleaning devices

features.name: First inlet screen
features.body: There are 9 litres of whey for every litre of curd. Made of stainless steel wedge wire, the inlet screen has gaps of just 0.25 mm between each wedge. This means a high proportion of the liquid can drain through the holes, but very few curd particles pass through.

features.name: Second whey screen
features.header: Catches the curd particles, maximizing yield
features.body: Any rogue curd particles that have not been caught by the first inlet screen, are caught in this, the second whey screen. All the whey that passes through the screen is immediately collected before it has had time to accumulate bacteria – so it can be categorized as ‘high-quality whey’.

features.name: Channel design
features.body: Baffle plates are strategically placed in the channel, generating turbulence in the mixture and ensuring the curds are evenly distributed across the width of the belt. This gives an even process throughout the mixture, and leads to a more consistent end product.

features.name: Draining belt with tapered perforations
features.header: High hygiene and minimal fines losses
features.body: The draining belt has tapered slots through which the curd particles pass. Once they have passed through the narrowest point – the inlet - the curd particles can fall through the wider part of the hole easily, without the risk of clogging.

features.name: Draining boosting stirrer
features.body: If pockets of whey accumulate on top of the curd mat, they simply remain there, leading to an uneven moisture distribution. This stirrer eliminates this problem by breaking up the curd mat so the whey can drain off through the perforated belt.

features.name: CIP separation hatch
features.body: The CIP separation hatch closes off part of the machine so pre-rinsing can begin in the upper house, even while product is still being removed from the lower house. This shortens the waiting time between production runs.

features.name: Salting & Mixing drum
features.header: Even distribution and correct amount of salt
features.body: The curd is first weighed, then precisely the required amount of salt is added to match this weight. The curd drops down into the mixing drum, which rotates in order to distribute the salt evenly throughout the curd mixture.

features.name: Fish bone belt support
features.body: The belt support has an open fish bone design which delivers a number of benefits. The most important one is that it reduces the level of friction between the belt and the support, so the belt can run smoothly without jumping. It gives an even wear across the belt, and does not leave black wear marks (that can occur when parallel support is used). Finally, it’s much easier to clean than a closed design since there are no CIP blind spots.

features.name: Side guides
features.body: Low friction plastic side guides rest on the belt itself. The absence of a gap between the belt and the guides means curds cannot escape through the sides. In this way, it prevents product losses. The guides also eliminate the possible issue of black spots on the cheese - which can be caused by stainless steel residue in a traditional design. Since the cheese is not in direct contact with the stainless-steel housing, heat losses are minimized, contributing to a consistent output.

name: Tetra Pak® Cheddaring machine 5 - 4300 series

options.name: Curd distribution tank
options.body: The curds are moved around the central cone by a paddle, ensuring an even distribution to all the outlets, and onwards to the block formers downstream. The tank also senses the level of curds, and only activates the filling sequence when there is sufficient product to start filling the block formers.

options.name: Additional stirrers
options.body: We offer additional stirrers that release more moisture from the curds, enabling the production of other cheese varieties using the same equipment.

benefits:
• Semi-automatic, two-way, harp cutter for producing random weights or cubes
  • Safe operation thanks safety features such as enclosed infeed / outfeed and cutting area
  • Compact design, ideal for production of volumes up to 2250 kg/hr (5000 lbs/hr)

features.name: Two-Harp system
features.body: Since it only has two cutting harps and no trim wires, the cheese pieces produced by this cutter are of variable size and shape. The result is cheese with a just-cut, artisanal effect that consumers appreciate.

features.name: Groove roller rest
features.body: The rollers rest in a groove; rather than being bolted down. This makes them easy to lift out and clean in a COP tank. The rest of the machine can be foamed, or simply washed with a bucket and brush.

features.name: Interchangable cutting harps
features.header: Easy to remove and replace without tools
features.body: Made of a frame and cutting wires held firmly in place by tighteners, the cutting harps are available in numerous configurations. They can be lifted out and replaced easily, using the handle on top of the frame.

features.name: Safety covers
features.body: A safety cover eliminates the risk of an operator coming into contact with the area where cutting takes place.

features.name: Catch pans
features.body: Pans are placed beneath the cutting beds to catch any trim loss that falls down between the rollers or to the sides during cutting, so nothing is wasted.

name: Tetra Pak® Cutting system H2

options.name: Choice of outfeeds
options.body: For the cheese outfeed, producers can choose between an angled discharge chute that feeds a hopper/conveyor, a short stainless-steel plate (610 mm or 2‘- big enough to hold 1.5 blocks), or a longer discharge bed with rollers for easy onward handling to the packaging unit.

options.name: Ambidextrous loading
options.body: The block cutter can be accessed and loaded from either side, which makes it easy to fit into your production area and preferred work flow. Cutter can be delivered for right, or left-hand operation.

benefits:
• Custom made cheese moulds
  • Highest quality materials
  • Worldwide delivery and support

features.name: Carron mould
features.header: Gouda shaped cheese and block model
features.body:
• Perfect drainage
  • Strong cheese rind
  • Hygienic design

features.name: Gouda Cheese mould
features.body:
• Perfect drainage
  • Strong cheese rind
  • Hygienic design

features.name: Long loaf mould
features.body:
• Perfect drainage
  • Strong cheese rind
  • Hygienic design

features.name: Long cylinder Mould
features.body:
• Perfect drainage
  • Strong cheese rind
  • Hygienic design

features.name: Euroblock mould
features.body:
• Perfect drainage
  • Strong cheese rind
  • Hygienic design

name: Moulds

benefits:
• High product consistency thanks to even salt distribution and thorough mixing
  • Set-up can be adjusted to produce a broad variety of cheese recipes
  • Proven durability, based on decades of engineering experience

features.name: Application specific agitators
features.header: Best curd control in the industry
features.body: After salt application, the curd is gently stirred by different types of agitators which are designed to ensure uniform salt distribution in specific applications. Stirring also allows the excess whey to be effectively drained from the cheese.

features.name: Salt distribution
features.body: When matched with the Tetra Pak® Salt-Dispenser 2, salt is gently delivered by means of a controlled airflow. It is then applied uniformly to the cheese by specially designed nozzles. This highly controlled process minimizes salt usage and, in combination with thorough mixing, provides optimal salt distribution. Multiple salt applications result in longer absorption times, optimal salt retention, consistent cheese moistures. A low level of abrasiveness leads to fewer cheese fines.

features.name: Quality of materials
features.body: The salty cheese and whey can create a highly corrosive environment inside the machine. Over our many decades of experience, we have optimized our equipment design with the quality of materials needed to ensure a long service life and to meet your demands for durability and reliability.

features.name: CIP isolation
features.body: To maximize production during CIP, the machine can be configured with a CIP isolation device. This allows production to continue on the Tetra Pak® Salting & Mellowing Conveyor while upstream equipment is being washed.

name: Tetra Pak® Salting Mellowing Conveyor

options.name: Wet scrubber
options.body: With this option, 99% of airborne solids are removed from the exhaust air stream. The scrubber is optimized to the Tetra Pak® Salting Mellowing Conveyor to minimize environmental impact resulting from solids emissions. Its design also minimizes water usage through re-use and recirculation.

options.name: Dual outlet
options.body: With this optional dual hygienic auger, you can divert the cheese into multiple downstream lines - the ultimate in plant flexibility.

benefits:
• Consistent product quality since the tank serves all block formers equally
  • Small footprint (approx. 1 m2) thanks to unique Q-seal
  • Filling sequence is activated only when there is sufficient curd in the tank, leading to economical operation

features.name: Paddle
features.body: The paddle revolves around the central cone of the tank, keeping the curd moving and ensuring that every block former is served with an even amount of product.

features.name: Patented Q-Seal
features.body: This unique seal was originally invented for use in Tetra Pak® cheese vats, but is now also used in this tank. Thanks to a Q-shaped cross section, it creates a watertight connection between the cone and the shaft inside the tank. This eliminates the risk of leaked product interfering with the workings of the drive – thus enabling it to be placed directly beneath the tank, which in turn enables a smaller machine footprint.

features.name: Level sensor
features.body: A sensor in the tank detects the level of curds, and only activates the filling sequence when there is sufficient product to start filling the block formers. This not only saves energy, but also prevents curd from cooling down.

name: Tetra Pak® Curd Distribution Tank

benefits:
• The most efficient, accurate and reliable cheese vat for dedicated production cheddar and mozzarella cheeses
  • Patented knife design and gentle heating process help keep product losses in check
  • Designed for easy access to seals (without removing the drive unit) enabling quick, safe maintenance

features.name: Single horizontal shaft
features.body: The horizontal shaft design maximizes the first whey discharge and prevents lumps from forming after whey discharge. It gives a highly reliable, repeatable result, making this unit ideal for volume producers of several similar cheese types, for whom efficiency is key.

features.name: Unique knife & frame design
features.header: Reduces mechanical stress and increases hygiene
features.body: The knives are only welded at one end of the knife frame, which gives the system a degree of elasticity, and reduces the risk of bending or breaking. This enables a longer lifetime, as well as increased repeatability. Furthermore, our unique design has been shown to reduce losses of fats and fines, and to inhibit the build-up of curd during production, thus enhancing hygiene.

features.name: Control system
features.header: Optimizes production of all cheese types
features.body: The control system can be used independently or fully integrated into your plant control system. Based on an analysis of the data generated, you can fine-tune your production to meet your priorities – such as preventing product waste or reducing processing time. It helps you get the best quality end product with the most efficient process, while allowing the maximum freedom to adapt recipes.

features.name: Access to seals
features.body: The seals can be accessed from the exterior or the vat without removing the drive unit. This makes them easy to reach for maintenance purposes. It reduces the time needed for servicing and increases safety of servicing. It also gets your production back up and running fast after a stop, with the minimum downtime.

features.name: Rennet dosing
features.header: Gives an even distribution of rennet and improves yield
features.body: The automatic dosing and distribution system ensures an even amount of rennet throughout the milk. In turn, this leads to accurate and even coagulation, thereby reducing product deviations and increasing yield. Since the manway doesn’t need to be opened to pour in rennet, hygiene is also enhanced.

name: Tetra Pak® Cheese Vat OST CH5

options.name: Coagulation sensor
options.body: The sensor contains an infrared light which detects when coagulation has begun. Based on this data, it calculates when cutting should start – leading to a more accurate and reliable result than is possible with manual control. If for some reason the milk is not coagulating properly, the sensor alerts the control panel, greatly reducing the downtime associated with this type of deviation.

header: Proven equipment, based on over 40 years of experience and expertise

benefits:
• Ideal for volume production thanks to best-in-class efficiency, accuracy and reliability
  • Patented knife design and gentle heating process help keep product losses in check
  • Designed for easy access to seals (without removing the drive unit) enabling quick, safe maintenance

features.name: Single horizontal shaft
features.body: The horizontal shaft design maximizes the first whey discharge and prevents lumps from forming after whey discharge. It gives a highly reliable, repeatable result, making this unit ideal for volume producers of several similar cheese types, for whom efficiency is key.

features.name: Unique knife & frame design
features.header: Reduces mechanical stress and increases hygiene
features.body: The knives are only welded at one end of the knife frame, which gives the system a degree of elasticity, and reduces the risk of bending or breaking. This enables a longer lifetime, as well as increased repeatability. Furthermore, our unique design has been shown to reduce losses of fats and fines, and to inhibit the build-up of curd during production, thus enhancing hygiene.

features.name: Dimple heating jacket
features.header: Improves heat transfer and control over the heating process
features.body: The curd/whey mixture is heated (or cooled) by a dimple jacket filled with hot water, which is wrapped around the vat. This method can achieve the same heat transfer effect as steam heating, but with a lower temperature. Moreover, the temperature is easier to control, which reduces fouling and denaturation of the whey proteins.

features.name: Stable Vat design
features.body: Over time, frequent heating and cooling of the vat can lead to cracks. Our vat design takes these temperature fluctuations into account. The critical areas are designed to allow a degree of movement, which reduces the risk of cracking and increases the lifetime of the equipment. In addition, the inner and outer wall of the tank are heated at the same time, allowing the vat to expand evenly.

features.name: Control system
features.header: Optimizes production of all cheese types
features.body: The control system can be used independently or fully integrated into your plant control system. Based on an analysis of the data generated, you can fine-tune your production to meet your priorities – such as preventing product waste or reducing processing time. It helps you get the best quality end product with the most efficient process, while allowing the maximum freedom to adapt recipes.

features.name: Access to seals
features.body: The seals can be accessed from the exterior or the vat without removing the drive unit. This makes them easy to reach for maintenance purposes. It reduces the time needed for servicing and increases safety of servicing. It also gets your production back up and running fast after a stop, with the minimum downtime.

features.body: The automatic dosing and distribution system ensures an even amount of rennet throughout the milk. In turn, this leads to accurate and even coagulation, thereby reducing product deviations and increasing yield. Since the manway doesn’t need to be opened to pour in rennet, hygiene is also enhanced.

name: Tetra Pak® Cheese Vat OST CH6

options.name: Coagulation sensor
options.body: The sensor contains an infrared light which detects when coagulation has begun. Based on this data, it calculates when cutting should start – leading to a more accurate and reliable result than is possible with manual control. If for some reason the milk is not coagulating properly, the sensor alerts the control panel, greatly reducing the downtime associated with this type of deviation.

header: Proven equipment, built on over 40 years of expertise

benefits:
• Dual overlapped augers enable thorough mixing and stretching of a broad spectrum of pasta filata cheeses
  • Compact, space-saving design (just 4m2)
  • Minimal maintenance, thanks to a dimpled auger body that eliminates the need for coating

features.name: Dimple pattern
features.body: During cooking, it is natural for cheese to stick to the heated product contact surfaces of the auger body. Having a dimple pattern on these surfaces significantly reduces this sticking and makes cleaning much easier. It also eliminates the need for a coating on the auger body.

features.name: Dual auger
features.body: The two augers thoroughly mix the cheese. They are positioned optimally to take full advantage of the natural roll-back effect of the cheese as it is passes through the outlet. In this way, it gives the best possible mixing and stretching performance.

features.name: Cream tank
features.body: During production, fresh water is added to the cooker-stretcher, typically at 2 litres /minute. Excess water flows over into the cream tank. When the liquid in the cream tank reaches a certain level, its contents are pumped to a separator for the fats to be recovered.

features.name: Automatic water fill
features.header: Keeps an optimal level of water flowing through the unit
features.body: This feature is designed to correct the water level if it drops too low at any time during production. A sensor in the water box detects the water level, automatically opens the water valve and refills the unit when necessary. Keeping an optimal level of fresh water flowing through the system ensures that the process runs smoothly, with a minimum of fat losses.

features.name: Dual heat exchange system
features.body: The dual system uses one brazed plate heat exchanger to heat utility water by steam. This utility water then flows against the cook water in a shell and tube heat exchanger. This allows a lower temperature to raise the temperature of the cook water to the required level, minimizing the risk of fouling and denaturation of proteins, ensuring a good end product flavour.

name: Tetra Pak® Cooker Stretcher DAW 1,2 & 6

options.name: Cyclone curd collector
options.body: If conveying curd pneumatically to your line, this optional equipment allows for a greater distance between the curd source and the cooker-stretcher. When the curd begins to swirl around inside the curd collector, it can fall down naturally, while the air is expelled through a top vent. For longer distances, this is more economical than a belt or auger-conveyor system.

benefits:
• High capacity is possible thanks to two sets of dual augers
  • Approximately half the footprint (6.5m2) of standard equipment for this capacity
  • Minimal maintenance, thanks to dimpled auger body that eliminates the need for coating

features.name: Dimple pattern
features.body: During cooking, it is natural for cheese to stick to the heated product contact surfaces of the auger body. Having a dimple pattern on these surfaces significantly reduces this sticking and makes cleaning much easier. It also eliminates the need for a coating on the auger body.

features.name: Two sets of dual augers
features.body: To achieve a higher capacity, this machine is designed with two sets of dual augers. The first set transports the curd through a turbulent water flow while heating the curd to melt-and-stretch temperature. The second set thoroughly mixes and stretches the cheese, taking full advantage of the natural roll-back effect of the curd as it passes through the outlet.

features.name: Dual heat exchange system
features.body: The dual system uses one brazed plate heat exchanger to heat utility water by steam. This utility water then flows against the cook water in a shell and tube heat exchanger. This allows a lower temperature to raise the temperature of the cook water to the required level, minimizing the risk of fouling and denaturation of proteins, ensuring a good end product flavour.

features.name: Cream tank
features.body: During production, fresh water is added to the cooker-stretcher, typically at 2 litres /minute. Excess water flows over into the cream tank. When the liquid in the cream tank reaches a certain level, its contents are pumped to a separator for the fats to be recovered.

features.name: Heated water jackets
features.body: One water jacket is wrapped around the front of the auger bodies and another around the back. Heated water is circulated inside the jackets, helping to keep the temperature of the cook-water consistent. The temperature of the water in the jackets can be controlled independently of the cook-water, and independently of one another.

features.name: Automatic water fill
features.header: Keeps an optimal level of water flowing through the unit

Keeping an optimal level of fresh water flowing through the system ensures that the process runs smoothly, with a minimum of fat losses.

When the curd begins to swirl around inside the curd collector, it can fall down naturally, while the air is expelled through a top vent. For longer distances, this is more economical than a belt or auger-conveyor system.

benefits:
• A high-capacity unit that feeds multiple moulding machines (e.g. 2 x Tetra Pak moulding machine RMC8’s or RMC12’s)
  • Gentle handing of curd, with a single low-speed auger in the baffle chamber
  • Multiple features ensure a high yield on ingredients - including the cream tank, single auger and dual heat exchange system

features.name: Single auger
features.body: Uniquely, this equipment has a single as opposed to a double auger. Baffle plates restrict the curd mass as it passes through the auger body, stretching and aligning the fibres as it goes. This design reduces unwanted cutting of the curd and reduces fat losses.

features.name: Dual heat exchange system
features.body: The dual system uses one brazed plate heat exchanger to heat utility water by steam. This utility water then flows against the cook water in a shell and tube heat exchanger. This allows a lower temperature to raise the temperature of the cook water to the required level, minimizing the risk of fouling and denaturation of proteins, ensuring a good end product flavour.

benefits:
• Offers thorough control over shred profile and dimensions
  • High output enabled by powerful motor, servo-drives and robust construction
  • Dual chamber allows for blending of different cheeses

features.name: Shred control
features.body: The length, width and thickness of shreds can all be adjusted, making it possible to adapt production to a broad range of different needs. The upset profile on our rotating disc creates a half moon shaped shred.

features.name: Dual chamber
features.header: Enables high output and blending of different cheeses
features.body: With dual chambers, two blocks of cheese can be loaded onto the unit at the same time. The pusher on one side pushes the first block of cheese through the disc. As it retracts, the pusher on the other side moves forward to shred the second block of cheese. This feature enables the blending of different cheese types and a higher production speed.

features.name: Enclosed containment centre
features.body: As it progresses towards the shredder wheel, the cheese is supported on all sides. This helps ensure a consistent output with shreds of equal length.

features.name: Robust construction
features.header: Enables shredding without pre-cutting or cubing
features.body: Thanks to the power of the servo-drive, high-strength knives, and overall heavy-duty design, this machine can shred whole blocks of cheese without pre-cutting or cubing. This eliminates the need for a pre-cutter or cuber on your line. With two fewer pieces of equipment to install, accommodate, clean and maintain you can save on space and costs.

features.name: Mechanical removal of scredding wheel
features.header: Easy removal of the wheel for cleaning
features.body: At the end of a production run, the wheel needs to be cleaned. We supply a wheel cart along with the shredder. The wheel is lifted mechanically off the shaft and placed on the cart for cleaning, eliminating the need for heavy manual lifting.

features.name: Servo-drives
features.body: Programmable servo drives control the speed of the pusher plate that is used to push the cheese through the horizontal knives of the shredder. This 100% electrical operation is clean and simple, enhancing food safety and virtually eliminating the need for maintenance.

name: Tetra Pak® Shredding system 9
header: Shred whole cheese blocks without pre-cutting

benefits:
• Offers thorough control over shred profile and dimensions
  • High performance enabled by powerful motor, servo-drives and robust construction
  • Ideal for long production runs of a single cheese type, with blending capabilities if required.
