benefits:
• High and consistent product quality and uncompromising food safety
  • Supreme flexibility and future proof
  • Low operating cost

features.name: Flexible hardware configuration
features.body: Carefully selected, tested and proven components make it easy to expand and upgrade your system to meet future capacity and production needs. There are also solutions for both your current and your future product portfolios, since the design enables you to process products – aseptic/non-aseptic or smooth/particulate – with a wide range of viscosities.

features.name: Optimized heat treatment
features.header: Consistently high quality and particle integrity
features.body: Components like pumps, homogenizers and deaerators are optimized for consistent stability and texture and particle integrity up to ø 25 mm. Heat treatment is also optimized to ensure quality, and combines efficient heat transfer with short retention times. The design, selection and configuration of your heat exchangers are all flexible.

features.name: Hygienic design
features.body: All components are carefully selected for tough operating conditions. Cleaning programmes are designed to assure food safety and optimized production efficiency, and enable you to create unique settings for caustic/alkali, high/low temperature, concentration and circulation time. Advanced automation reduces the chance of human error and enables full traceability.

features.name: PLC-based control
features.body: Our user-friendly PLC-based control gives you full control over recipes and parameters and enables you to make the most of your production plant. You get a good return on your investment, thanks to minimal opportunities for human error, consistent quality, high throughput and lower costs. Take control a step further with our Tetra Pak® PlantMaster supervisory system for control rooms, giving you the convenience of flowchart overviews, product routing/selection, advanced data logging, automated reporting, full traceability and easy preventive maintenance.

features.name: Automated and optimized emptying and filling
features.body: Due to automation, the emptying and filling functions are very precise. A control system measures the concentration of product to water much more accurately than is possible with manual operation. The reduction in product waste, and consequent cost savings are dramatic. We’ve calculated that producers can save between €17,000 – 35,000 per year – assuming four product changes at a revenue of €1/litre product.

name: Tetra Pak® Indirect UHT unit PFF with THE

options.name: Deaerator – Eco vacuum and Eco cooling
options.body: Thanks to the closed circuit for the condenser cooling medium, water consumption can be cut by up to 2,600 l/h. This refers to a unit with a capacity of 5,000 l/h. The addition of a small, brazed plate heat exchanger means you can close the loop in the water system so that it recirculates rather than going down the drain.

benefits:
• High and consistent product quality and uncompromising food safety
  • Supreme flexibility and future proof
  • Low operating cost

features.name: Inline blending
features.body: Our uniquely accurate continuous blending give your products consistent quality. Exactly the right amount of rice is introduced into the milk at all times, and the particles are continuously and evenly distributed throughout the product. The result is a rice pudding with exactly the right texture and colour. The same applies to other desserts produced in this unit – mousses, custards, fruit preparations and cream cheese.

features.name: Advanced recipe handling
features.body: As part of Tetra Pak®’s advanced automation system, cooking time, cooking temperature and filling temperature can all be pre-set. This makes it is easy to configure new recipes and prevents the risk of human error.

features.name: Tangential inlet
features.body: The product flows naturally through the heat exchanger, thanks to a tangential inlet. Since no change of direction is necessary, there is very little impact on the product.

features.name: Built in scrapers
features.body: Inside the heat exchanger, scrapers continuously remove product from the cylinder walls. This ensures uniform heat treatment, and prevents the product from fouling and thereby avoids a burned taste.

features.name: Integrated rotor lift
features.body: The heat exchanger is equipped with a built-in, hydraulically driven rotor lift. Easily operated by a handle to the side of the unit, this lift means that maintenance and service jobs can be performed quickly and safely.

name: Tetra Pak® Indirect UHT unit PFF with SSHE

benefits:
• High and consistent product quality and uncompromising food safety
  • Supreme flexibility and future proof
  • Maximizes production and operational efficiency

features.name: Tetra Pak® Coiled Heat Exchanger
features.body: The heat exchanger is designed to handle particles gently. There are no moving parts, a short retention time due to efficient heat transfer and just a few inlet and outlet connections. All this enables very gentle mechanical treatment, which means that particles remain intact.

features.name: Heat transfer calculation model
features.body: Thanks to a very accurate way of calculating the heat required to process each individual product, heat loads are optimized in this unit. The system volumes remain small and retention times short. All this reduces the risk of overcooking and maintains the product's natural taste

features.name: Flow pattern in coiled tubes
features.body: The coiled heat exchanger is designed in such a way as to achieve the ‘Dean effect’ - a natural law that comes into effect when particle turbulence is very high. A velocity of up to 4 metres per second in the tube makes for highly effective heat transfer. There is a relatively small volume of product in the coil at any given time, and therefore very little product is lost during emptying and filling.

features.name: Hygienic design
features.body: All components are carefully selected for tough operating conditions. Cleaning programmes are designed to assure food safety and optimized production efficiency, and enable you to create unique settings for caustic/alkali, high/low temperature, concentration and circulation time. Advanced automation reduces the chance of human error and enables full traceability.

features.name: Flexible hardware configuration
features.body: Carefully selected, tested and proven components make it easy to expand and upgrade your system to meet future capacity and production needs. There are also solutions for both your current and your future product portfolios, since the design enables you to process products – aseptic/non-aseptic or smooth/particulate – with a wide range of viscosities.

name: Tetra Pak® Indirect UHT unit PFF with CHE

benefits:
• Gain access to all our food engineering know-how
  • Low total cost of ownership with guarantees
  • Flexible and future-proof

features.name: Flexible heat exchanger set-up
features.header: Broadens the possible range of applications
features.body: High viscous products (or low viscous, high heat products) typically require tubular heat exchangers, which are capable of processing up to 140°C. Plate heat exchangers are more suitable for low viscous products. The Tetra Pak® Pasteurizer PFC offers a flexible heat exchanger configuration so you can process a broad range of prepared food products.

features.name: Automated and optimized emptying and filling
features.body: The automation of machine emptying and filling functions is very precise, thanks to a control system which measures the concentration of product to water much more accurately than is possible with manual operation. The reduction in product waste, and hence cost savings, is dramatic. We’ve calculated that producers can save between €17,000 – 35,000 per year – assuming four product changes and a revenue of €1/litre product.

features.name: Modular equipment design
features.header: Speeds up introduction of new products by 20%
features.body: The machine is modular. It is tested and validated prior to delivery, and based on proven line concepts that have been designed for prepared food applications. This means the time required for delivery, commissioning and start-up of production are all shortened by up to 20% compared with a fully customized solution. This helps minimize the time it takes to launch a new product on the market.

features.name: Flexible degree of automation
features.body: Depending on the customer’s unique situation, we can offer different degrees of automation. Stand-alone automation gives you information about temperatures, flows and alarms, for a minimum investment. A full line solution makes it possible to access information about all the equipment including the mixer, tanks and of course the pasteurizer itself. A third option is to have the entire factory site integrated into a single supervisory system Tetra PlantMaster, showing how all your lines are operating.

name: Tetra Pak® Pasteurizer PFC
header: A highly versatile and investment-efficient food pasteurizer

benefits:
• Cut ingredient and operational costs significantly thanks to high precision
  • Ensure reliable production with consistent product quality
  • Get unlimited capabilities to meet your specific needs

features.name: Advanced software
features.body: Built-in control software regulates the quantity of ingredients used in the product mix. This highly controlled process gives a consistent product quality – a predictable end product for consumers and a consistent yield for producers. At the same time, it increases profitability since the high level of accuracy means virtually no ingredients are 'given away'.

features.name: Multiple ingredients handling
features.body: Capable of handling up to eleven individual ingredients streams at the same time, this unit can be used to formulate almost any product. All ingredient and product parameters are managed by an advanced recipe manager using a mass balance equation. This keeps precise control of the product formulation and standardization process in order to deliver the product (on specification) to the next processing step.

features.name: In-line production method
features.body: With inline production, product flows through the system continuously. This method is economical for larger production volumes and, since it requires fewer tanks (compared to batch production), product losses caused by hold up volumes are considerably reduced.

features.name: Fewer buffer tanks
features.header: Low utilities consumption and hence operational costs
features.body: Continuous production requires fewer buffer tanks than batch production, and hence the overall consumption of utilities is reduced. To give an example, the removal of one 20,000 litre tank reduces water consumption by 600m3/yr, power needs by 26,400 kWh/yr, and CO2 emissions by 13 tonnes/yr.

features.name: Automated production system
features.body: Thanks to an automated control system, all the operator needs to do is select a production recipe. This is then communicated to the Tetra Pak® In-line Blender D system, which executes the recipe without the need for further operator intervention. The amount of time an operator needs to attend to the unit is therefore negligible.

name: Tetra Pak® In-line Blender D

options.name: SpotOn technology
options.header: Lets you fulfil product specification accurately
options.body: In continuous production, when switching from one raw material tank to another, there is a pressure drop in the ingredient in-feed line. This pressure drop creates a disturbance in the ingredient supply causing an incorrect amount of ingredient in the product. The SpotOn feature is designed to detect this disturbance, calculate its impact and directly compensate by topping up or reducing the amount of ingredients into the system. It thus ensures your product specification is always accurately fulfilled.

header: Efficient production cuts costs and secures quality

benefits:
• Cut operational costs significantly – and achieve lowest TCO in the industry
  • Get the highest flexibility – today and for the future
  • Secure consistent product quality and food safety

features.name: Mixing head with patented balanced rotor/stator system
features.header: Allow full control of mixing intensity
features.body: The placement of the mixing head, outside of the traditional mixing tank, enables free control of shear and eliminates vortex altogether, preventing air introduction. Its mechanical design is hydrodynamically balanced to allow very high speeds and narrow tolerances. It is designed only for mixing and shear, i.e., not for pumping or tank flow, for significant energy savings.

features.name: Independently controlled twin-screw pump – patented in combination with mixer and deaerator
features.header: Handles low and high viscous products – and extremely low suction pressures
features.body: The pump circulates both low and high-viscous products even under very poor suction conditions without risk for cavitation. The twin screws impart very low shear and allow passage of large particles – up to 20 millimetres in diameter depending on screw pitch. It also pumps CIP fluids, eliminating the need for a separate CIP pump

features.name: Vacuum deaerator – patented in combination with mixer and pump
features.header: Prevent air incorporation and reduce need for deaeration
features.body: The new design means no air is incorporated since all rotating devices have been removed from the deaerator. Specially designed nozzles distribute the two inlet streams smoothly over a conical structure inside the vacuum deaerator. This generates a thin product film with a large surface area for faster and more complete deaeration. It also prevents splashing and thus foam generation.

features.name: Independently controlled and patented powder introduction solution
features.header: Flexibly place powder handling and reduce air incorporation
features.body: The powder introduction solution – with a patented switch injector, a double-switch inlet and a patented new vibrating powder hopper – lets you place the powder handling area far away from the mixer and significantly reduce air introduced with powder.

name: Tetra Pak® High Shear Mixer R370-1000D

options.name: Additional vibrating powder hopper
options.header: Vibrates and compacts powder ingredients to minimize air incorporation
options.body: The powder hopper is suspended on springs and the vibrating device initiates completely silent large amplitude oscillations very efficient for compacting the powder. A secondary body suspended on springs inside the hopper, automatically oscillates when not completely covered by powder preventing a severe source of air introduction known as a rat hole.

options.name: Additional switch injector
options.header: Allows you to add more powders from two different locations
options.body: The additional switch injector enables you to customize powder addition to fit your setup, e.g., addition from a Big Bag station – or if you wish to place the mixer at a distance from the dry room or powder handling area.

header: Agile and cost-efficient to meet your needs today – and for the future

benefits:
• Exceptional and consistent product quality with smart features to detect deviations
  • Outstanding efficiency and low production costs, thanks to savings on wrapping material and high production speed
  • Recipe handling and several exchangeable modules enable highly flexible production

features.name: Integrated paper rack
features.body: The paper rack is mounted onto the machine rather than on an external rack. This reduces space requirements and makes it easy for operators to access the paper rolls and replace them, while minimizing friction. The lack of friction also enables the use of thinner wrapping material.

features.name: Quick release handle
features.header: Enables wrapping of different product types and sizes
features.body: Different paper formers are needed depending on the size and the shape of the product and wrapping material width. In this unit, there is a quick release handle, which makes it easy to switch paper formers (without tools) whenever a different product it going to be made.

features.name: Individual fin seal drive & sealing module
features.body: Designed with an individual fin seal drive and sealing module, this unit enables easy threading of one lane at a time. That means fast and safe product changes, with the minimum waste of wrapping material. It also enables the features called ‘no-product-no-wrapping’ and fast photo registration (or ‘picture in place’ wrapping).

features.name: Cross sealing & cutting module
features.body: This module moves in a box motion pattern, which means the wrapping material is held together for an optimal length of time and at the correct temperature to form a reliable seal. An integrated fast moving cutting device cuts the packaging material within the jaws during sealing.

features.name: Replaceable modules
features.body: The fin and cross seal modules are designed for fast replacement, with power outlets for air and power connections. Having an additional set of modules means you can remove one when a wear part needs replacing without prolonged interruption to your production. The switch typically takes ten minutes.

name: Tetra Pak® Multilane Wrapper 1900 A2

options.name: Paper break detection
options.body: If a reel of paper gets torn, the unit automatically stops the individual paper lane and alerts the operator so he/she can reconnect it. At the same time, it stops incoming products on that lane and exits them automatically before the in-feed to prevent a product pile up.

options.name: Choice of date coding options
options.body: This unit is compatible with a range of different date coding systems, including drop on demand, continuous inkjet, thermal inkjet and laser. The code is printed lengthways on the wrapper in the desired position.

options.name: Photo mark registration
options.header: Positions product correctly in the wrapper
options.body: This sensor ensures that the product is aligned with the printed design on the wrapper so that each wrapped product coming off the line looks the same. This also makes it possible for producers to decide exactly where the date code appears on the product.

options.name: Individual lane exit
options.body: An individual lane exit at the wrapper outlet allows non-conforming products and empty or joined wraps to be removed rather than being further conveyed for cartoning. The system detects certain non-conformities by itself; the operator can detect other issues and, if necessary, override the system.

header: Taking wrapping performance to a whole new level

benefits:
• Exceptional and consistent product quality with smart features to detect deviations
  • Outstanding efficiency and low production costs, thanks to savings on wrapping material and high production speed
  • Recipe handling and several exchangeable modules enable highly flexible production

features.name: Replaceable modules
features.body: The fin and cross seal modules are designed for fast replacement, with power outlets for air and power connections. Having an additional set of modules means you can remove one when a wear part needs replacing without prolonged interruption to your production. The switch typically takes ten minutes.

name: Tetra Pak® Multilane Wrapper 1200 A2

options.name: Paper break detection
options.body: If a reel of paper gets torn, the unit automatically stops the individual paper lane and alerts the operator so he/she can reconnect it. At the same time, it stops incoming products on that lane and exits them automatically before the in-feed to prevent a product pile up.

options.name: Choice of date coding options
options.body: This unit is compatible with a range of different date coding systems, including drop on demand, continuous inkjet, thermal inkjet and laser. The code is printed lengthways on the wrapper in the desired position.

options.name: Photo mark registration
options.header: Positions product correctly in the wrapper
options.body: This sensor ensures that the product is aligned with the printed design on the wrapper so that each wrapped product coming off the line looks the same. This option is also necessary for producers who want to decide exactly where the date code appears on the product.

options.name: Individual lane exit
options.body: An individual lane exit at the wrapper outlet allows non-conforming products and empty or joined wraps to be removed rather than being further conveyed for cartoning. The system detects certain non-conformities by itself; the operator can detect other issues and, if necessary, override the system.

benefits:
• Exceptional product uniformity with optimal texture (< 2 % standard deviation)
  • Easy installation thanks to self contained refrigeration system
  • Production system designed for accurate and repeatable output

features.name: Rotary pumps
features.header: Gives precise production and minimises waste
features.body: The most precise pumps on the market are used in this freezer, ensuring an accurate flow of product and guaranteeing production stability with repeatable results and low waste. The pumps are cleaned automatically during the freezer’s own CIP cycle.

features.name: Mass flow meter
features.body: A mass flow meter ensures that precisely the desired amount of air enters the freezing cylinder and is incorporated into the mixture. More or less air can be incorporated to vary product texture as needed, with minimal production fluctuations and hence minimal waste. The meter can handle up to 140% overrun, enabling products with a high air content.

features.name: IE3 motors
features.body: Built with the most energy efficient motors, this unit keeps power consumption down to a minimum, thereby reducing running costs.

features.name: Heavy-duty shaft seal
features.body: The shaft seal is made of hard metal steel in order to withstand production of mixtures with coarse particles without wearing out the components prematurely. It offers up to 3000 hours of wear life, which is approximately three times the length that of a standard shaft seal.

features.name: Space efficient design
features.body: Thanks to the choice of a modern space efficient compressor and optimized piping, this freezer offers an unusually high output for a footprint of only 1.66 m2.

features.name: Operator control panel
features.body: A user-friendly touch screen shows operators what is happening and enables storage of up to 100 different product recipes. Since the machine doesn’t have to be fine-tuned before each new production run, start-up process is quick and efficient. It also means that staff can operate the machine with minimal training.

name: Tetra Pak® Continuous Freezer S1500 A2

options.name: Dual outlet pumps
options.header: Feed product lanes without extra costs
options.body: With dual outlet pumps, you can feed two product lanes from a single freezer, or four lanes from two freezers, and still get a precise, consistent volume of product distributed into each container. Start-up waste, spare parts and maintenance costs are all reduced by 50 %.

options.name: Variable dasher speed
options.body: This option is designed for producers with special requirements. For example, a product that needs to be whipped harder than usual, or perhaps a high-end product, which requires fine-tuned agitation for optimized texture and mouth feel. By manually adjusting the speed, it is possible to get the desired result and save energy at the same time.

benefits:
• High product quality thanks to gentle handling of ingredients - inclusions remain in tact
  • A loss-in-weight control system and optimized auger selection ensures accurate dosing of expensive ingredients
  • Production method guarantees even distribution of added ingredients throughout the product

features.name: Hopper lid
features.header: Enables easy access and flexible line layout
features.body: Since the lid over the hopper flips up from right to left, ingredients can be added from two sides at a low re-feeding height. This gives operators easy access from two angles, and if required, two dosers can be placed beside one another without obstructing the refill process.

features.name: Turnable operator panel
features.header: Enables easy access and flexible line layout
features.body: The operator panel is placed on top of the electrical cabinet on a swivel base, which makes it possible for operators to turn it to the best viewing angle, and to reach the touch screen easily.

features.name: Choice of augers
features.body: As the auger turns, the ingredients are transferred at a steady dosing rate from the hopper to the pump. This unit can be fitted with a variety of different augers, and they are easy to change. This means your dosing is always optimised for the product type, size and required capacity range.

features.name: Lamella pump
features.body: Ingredients are fed into the lamella pump and the cavities between the lamellas carry the inclusions into the pressurized product zone. The pump is designed to transfer the ingredients gently into the pressurized base product, without breaking or damaging them, and without incorporating any air into the mixture.

features.name: Compact design
features.body: Thanks to the unit’s small footprint (0.9 m2) it can be used in almost all production plants, even where space is limited.

features.name: Loss-in-weight control system
features.header: Accurate and repeatable dosing (3% lowest standard deviation)
features.body: The loss-in-weight control system, combined with the correct auger selection, make it possible for this unit to deliver extremely accurate dosing. It typically achieves a standard deviation dosing rate of less than 3%, depending on the size and type of inclusion.

features.name: CIP front cover
features.header: Minimizes the risk of damage to the pump
features.body: For best results when cleaning, all the tight tolerances inside the lamella pump should be released to enable thorough flush through. This is achieved with an automatic CIP front cover inside the pump’s closed system. It also ensures you have the right pressure during operation, and thereby reduces wear and tear of pump parts during both operation and cleaning.

features.name: Patented hopper design
features.body: Several smart features enable gentle handling of sensitive and brittle inclusions such as cookie pieces and fruit in thus unit. The agitator moves back and forth without spinning, and the auger is shaped to enable gradual filling and even takeout. This minimizes circulation inside the hopper and prevents clumps from forming. A grooved outlet pipe releases ingredients evenly into the product pump inlet funnel.

name: Tetra Pak® Ingredient Doser 4000 A2

options.name: Ventilated lamellas
options.header: Enables a broad variety of large inclusions
options.body: The lamellas are designed with ventilation holes to ensure that all the air is released from large inclusions such as cookies, which may have a lot of trapped air inside them. When the pressurized base product meets the cavity, it naturally replaces any air that may be present between the inclusions, and that air then escapes through the ventilation holes.

options.name: Magnetic grill
options.body: Placed on top of the hopper, the magnetic grill is designed to trap any foreign objects made of metal, which may have found their way into the ingredients packages. Although this is a rare occurrence, an error can have dramatic consequences, so it is worth safeguarding your production with this simple option.

options.name: Insulated hopper
options.body: Soft inclusions such as fruit pieces often benefit from being injected cooled or pre-frozen. This not only maintains their natural shape, but also makes them easier to integrate into the ice cream - without causing it to melt.

options.name: Line integration
options.header: Minimizes operator interference and reduces running costs
options.body: A communication package that enables communication between the freezer and the downstream equipment. Shared recipe handling and production hold signals reduce the need for operator interference. Also, by sharing flow signals to downstream equipment like ingredients dosers, the use of ingredients can be optimized to the actual outlet flow from the freezer.

header: Highest capacity and uniformity; lowest production cost

benefits:
• Easily adapt to produce a wide range of products
  • Easily add extra modules to adapat to future production needs
  • Highly compact and robust design saves space and enables easy operation

features.name: Ingenious gripper head cradle
features.body: When changing from one kind of product to another, from stick to sandwich for example, it is necessary to change the gripper head. An ingenious solution, in which the gripper head is placed in a cradle and fast connection air fittings are used, allows operators to have both hands free for assembling and disassembling the gripper head. Thus, changing the gripper head only takes two operators about one minute to complete.

features.name: Overlapping grippers
features.body: The gripper head is equipped with up to 24 grippers. The grippers’ profiles overlap, which means they can pick up a product even if it is not positioned in precisely the correct spot. They also pick up everything from the trays - no product escapes! Used in both pick up and lay down, this feature is unique to our dip and transfer units.

features.name: Chocolate tank
features.header: Coating precision reduces giveaway and saves money
features.body: The chocolate tank keeps chocolate and other coating matter at a steady temperature and is controlled by the dip and transfer unit. Two pumps circulate the coating matter and keep the dipping cup topped up, so exactly the right amount of chocolate is applied to each ice cream, with minimal giveaway.

features.name: Dipping divisions
features.body: The coating tank may be split into two sections, each one equipped with a pump and an agitator. This makes it possible to coat two different products, with or without inclusions, and thereby create variety packs.

features.name: Dip-cup design
features.header: Uniform distribution of dry ingredients (rice puffs, nuts, almond splits, etc.)
features.body: The chocolate tank’s dip-cup design ensures a continuous flow of chocolate all throughout the cup and ensures uniform products with the dry ingredients evenly distributed in the chocolate coating. The tank is designed with a sloped bottom and no corners, preventing build up of dry ingredients.

features.name: Dipping control system
features.body: Once set by the operator, the dipping speed, time and level are all automatically controlled by the recipe handling system. This ensures the correct amount of expensive ingredients such as chocolate are applied - no more no less – and that the process is perfectly repeatable.

features.name: Tool-free dismantling
features.body: Pumps and dip cup are dismantled without using any tools, and there is no risk of damaging parts. All parts are constructed so that it’s impossible to mount them incorrectly or in the wrong place. This optimizes the cleaning process.

features.name: Lay down system
features.header: Enhances food safety and wrapping accuracy
features.body: This servo-driven system is designed to gently place the product in exactly the right position on the paper lane. The absence of contact with human hands also eliminates contamination risks.

features.name: Fence guard
features.body: A stainless steel fence is placed around the whole unit with pre-determined exits for non-conforming products. Its open wire mesh design enhances safety and hygiene without limiting visibility.

features.name: Double indexing of products
features.body: The faster a product is wrapped and send to cold storage, the better the quality of the product. The unit can also be set to run with double indexing for products that do not require dipping, reducing the time from pick up to lay down in the wrapping machine by half.

name: Tetra Pak® Dip and Transfer unit 1800 M2

options.name: Wrapping options
options.header: Choice of investment level and capacity needs
options.body: Choose between simple, standard, single lane wrapping to begin production at a lower investment and lower capacity. If you need to increase capacity, a second single lane wrapper can be added or you can switch to a multilane wrapper, simply by adding on modules to the unit.

options.name: Conveyer for chocolate enrobing
options.body: Enables production of chocolate-enrobed products without sticks. Instead of placing the products in a product lamella, it places them on a conveyer belt. The conveyer transfers the products further, for example, to a chocolate enrober. When the conveyer is not in use it can be folded up and stored without dismantling.

options.name: Exchange parts
options.body: An optional set of pick-up grippers, lamellas and lay down grippers makes it possible to go from e.g. production of ice cream sticks to sandwich, ball top cone or wafer cups, or from production of one size of product to another. Each set is optimized for a specific product. Pick-up heads for transferring to the conveyor for chocolate enrobing of sandwiches, ice cream slices, candy bars and bite size products are also available as options.

header: Prepared for present and future production needs

benefits:
• Can be adapted easily to produce a broad range of products
  • Robust design and several smart features enable trouble-free operation
  • Consistent product quality and low operational cost thanks to high precision coating

features.name: Dipping divisions
features.body: The coating tank can be split into up to four sections, each one equipped with a pump and an agitator. This makes it possible to coat four different products, with or without inclusions, and thereby create variety packs. A typical series of coatings might be dark chocolate, milk chocolate, white chocolate, and milk chocolate with split almond inclusions.

features.name: Dipping control system
features.body: Once set by the operator, the dipping speed, time and level are all automatically controlled by the recipe handling system. This ensures the correct amount of expensive ingredients such as chocolate are applied - no more no less – and that the process is perfectly repeatable.

features.name: Level control sensor
features.body: A sensor in the chocolate tank monitors the base level of coating matter and alerts the operator when it is time to re-feed the tank. This helps ensure both a steady supply and steady temperature, which keeps production on target.

features.name: Lay down system
features.header: Enhances food safety and wrapping accuracy
features.body: This servo driven system is designed to gently place the product in exactly the right position on the paper lane. In addition, it lays down the product in one position at a time, enabling the ‘no-product, no-wrap feature’ of our wrapping machines. The absence of contact with human hands also eliminates contamination risks.

features.name: Light curtain
features.body: Positioned between the two ends of the dipping sections, the light curtain acts as an invisible door. When the light panel is broke, the machine stops automatically. This enhances safety and hygiene without limiting visibility or requiring cleaning. Restart takes under 1 minute.

features.name: Dipping system
features.body: length and modular design of the dipping area means you can have 25 dipping stations in this unit. This makes it possible to produce ice cream products with lot of different coatings - chocolate, caramel, juice or other – individually or in combination.

features.name: Chocolate tank
features.body: This is a complete self-contained unit for heating coating matter such as chocolate. Equipped with a water jacket, it keeps the coating matter at a steady temperature. Four pumps and agitators circulate the liquid and keep the dipping cup topped up, so exactly the right amount of chocolate is applied to each ice cream, with minimal giveaway.

features.name: Overlapping grippers
features.body: Each gripper head is equipped with up to 12 grippers. The grippers’ profiles overlap, which means they can pick up a product even if it is not positioned in precisely the correct spot. They also pick up everything from the trays - no product escapes! Used in both pick up and lay down, this feature is unique to Tetra Pak®’s dip and transfer unit.

name: Tetra Pak® Dip and Transfer unit 2000 A3

options.name: Long Dip module
options.body: When coating ice creams with juice, the challenge is to get a thick, even coating across the whole product. This is achieved with our optional add-on Long Dip module, which moves the product horizontally through several indexes in the dipping tank – ensuring it is submerged for the required amount of time.

options.name: Coating control
options.header: Ensures the correct ratio between dry and liquid coating matter
options.body: A mass flow meter at the chocolate inlet measures the chocolate flow into an external mixing tank. Meanwhile, the dry stuff dosing unit measures the dry stuff feed (e.g. split almonds). Working in unison, they ensure the correct ratio of dry and liquid coating products in the mix. This gives an even distribution of coatings and saves money on expensive ingredients.

options.name: Extra tank
options.body: When switching from one type of coating matter to another, it only takes one minute to exchange dipping tanks. Having an extra tank available saves waiting time for cleaning. It is especially valuable when producing ice cream coated with nuts, since no traces of a nut coated product may appear in a product without nuts.

options.name: Exchange parts
options.body: An optional set of pick-up grippers, lamellas and lay down grippers makes it possible to go from e.g. production of ice cream sticks to sandwich, ball top cone or wafer cups, or from production of one size of product to another. Each set is optimized for a specific product. Pick-up heads for transferring to the conveyor for chocolate enrobing of sandwiches, ice cream slices, candy bars and bite size products are also available as options.

options.name: Dry coating function
options.body: This optional unit it used to produce ice cream sticks and ball top cones which have the dry coating on the outside of the chocolate, rather than mixed into it.

header: Efficient dipping unit for lowest total cost

benefits:
• High speed operation and a range of smart features enable the lowest cost per product on the market
  • Modular design and easy cleaning deliver product versatility with secure product changeovers
  • Product quality is consistent, with on target output (standard deviation below 1%)

features.name: Modular design
features.header: Easily adapted to meet a range of needs
features.body: A modular design maximizes versatility with regard to the product being made and the capacity required. Moreover, the layout of the equipment, the choice of tray size and the equipment placement on the worktable can all be varied to meet your needs.

features.name: Double fan set-up
features.body: The Tetra Pak® tunnel has two sets of fans that circulate cooled air around the products, to ensure they are efficiently and evenly hardened. These fans deliver the desired hardening effect with the lowest possible power consumption, thereby reducing production costs.

features.name: Servo cutter
features.body: The servo cutter slices the extruded ice cream with a high degree of precision every time (standard deviation below 1%). This, combined with the fact that the Tetra Pak® freezer upstream delivers a well mixed and consistent stream of product, means that every single ice cream coming off the line is the correct and the same size.

features.name: Automatic stick inserter
features.header: Enhances food safety and production reliability
features.body: With an automatic stick inserter, operators just need to load up boxes of sticks, and they receive an alert when it’s time to reload. This gives several advantages: there is no contamination risk from human contact; boxes cost less than bundled sticks, and one person can easily handle a four lane production line. This feature also supports the unit’s high operational speed – up to 200 sticks per minute per lane.

features.name: Start-up process design
features.header: Efficient, hygienic and minimizes product losses
features.body: Preparation for production is carried out outside the tray to ensure safe and clean start-up without the risk of contamination. As the ice cream mixture enters the extrusion nozzles, they are gradually cooled down. When they reach the right temperature and fill out the nozzle to form the correct shape, the operator sets the cutter in motion. The size of each ice cream slice can then be measured, and when it is correct, the operating system can be moved over to the production trays. This start-up process means there are no non-conforming products on the tray and no mess.

features.name: Product release system
features.body: When it’s time to pick the products up and transfer them to the down stream equipment, they have to be released from the tray in a controlled way, to avoid shifting their position or damaging them. Our system gently holds the ice creams in place, while tapping them to free them from the contact surface.

features.name: Worktable-equipment interface
features.header: Easy switch between different product types
features.body: This unit has a well-defined and standardized interface between the equipment and the worktable. It consists of identical mounting points where the equipment used to create (and differentiate) products is mounted. Production is easily varied, simply by switching and moving fillers, decoration equipment, biscuit dispensers etc.

name: Tetra Pak® Extrusion Tunnel A3

options.name: Dehumidifier
options.body: If planning to run continuous operation for several days in a row, it is important to control the humidity in the hardening tunnel to prevent frost build up. The dehumidifier supplies dry air to the tunnel and keeps the moisture level down.

options.name: Add-on and exchange modules
options.header: Enabling production of a broad range of ice creams
options.body: Whatever kind of ice cream you want to produce, there is an add-on module or modules to make it possible. Different stick product size and shape, full and half sandwiches, ice cream slices, candy bars, bite size, ball top cones, wafer cups, decorated cakes, logs etc.

options.name: Special hardening trays
options.header: Broadening the range of possible products
options.body: With the addition of special trays, the line can also be used for hardening of flat top cones, cups and boxed products. In this instance, the product is typically supplied from a filling machine rather than being ‘made’ on the worktable.

options.name: Internal cladding
options.body: This option consists of an insulated housing with fully welded stainless steel cladding on the inside, which allows for heavy washing. Welding eliminates the need for caulk seal assemblies and so minimizes the risk of bacterial contamination. Equipped with this option, your extrusion tunnel meets the strictest food safety regulations.

options.name: Large inclusions with Tetra Pak® Extrusion Wheel
options.header: Capture new opportunities with patented new design
options.body: A vertical vertical rotating wheel shapes ice cream products with large inclusions – up to 25 mm in size – and places them precisely and gently on the worktable trays for further handling. The unit requires only one metre of space on the worktable and interfaces quickly and seamlessly with all our A series extrusion lines with no special arrangement. Only electricity is required. Produce and quickly develop new products including sandwiches, stick products, bars and slices with a wide range of sticky, fragile and chunky large inclusions – and combined with liquid ripple.

benefits:
• Meets your present and future needs, thanks to easy add-on of extra modules
  • High capcity in relation to footprint - 275 products / m2 / hour
  • Modular design and easy cleaning deliver product versatility with secure product changeovers

features.name: Modular design
features.header: Easily adapted to meet a range of production needs
features.body: The unit is designed in modules to maximize versatility with regard to the product. The layout of the equipment and its placement on the worktable can all be varied to enable the production of several kinds of ice creams

features.name: Servo cutter
features.body: The servo cutter slices the extruded ice cream with a high degree of precision every time independed of speed on line (standard deviation below 1%). This, combined with the fact that the Tetra Pak® freezer upstream delivers a well mixed and consistent stream of product, means that every single ice cream coming off the line is the correct and the same size

features.name: Start-up process design
features.header: Enhances hygiene and minimizes product losses
features.body: Preparation for production is carried out outside the tray to ensure safe and clean start-up without the risk of contamination. As the ice cream mixture enters the extrusion nozzles, they are gradually cooled down. When they reach the right temperature and fill out the nozzle to form the correct product shape, the operator can move the nozzles over the product trays and set the cutter in motion.

features.name: Worktable-equipment interface
features.header: Easy switch between different product types
features.body: This unit has a well-defined and standardized interface between the equipment and the worktable. It consists of identical mounting points where the equipment used to create (and differentiate) products is mounted. Production is easily varied, simply by switching and moving fillers, decoration equipment, biscuit dispensers etc.

features.name: Lubrication-free tunnel
features.body: To prevent the risk of black spots, no lubrication is used inside the tunnel. Only lubrication free components are used on the inside, while the main drive is placed outside the freezing zone - which also facilitates maintenance.

name: Tetra Pak® Extrusion Tunnel M3

options.name: Dehumidifier
options.body: If planning to run continuous operation for several days in a row, it is important to control the humidity in the hardening tunnel to prevent frost build up. The dehumidifier supplies dry air to the tunnel and keeps the moisture level down.

options.name: Automatic stick inserter
options.header: Enhances food safety and production reliability
options.body: With an automatic stick inserter, operators just need to load up boxes of sticks, and they receive an alert when it’s time to reload. This gives several advantages: there is no contamination risk from human contact; boxes cost less than bundled sticks, and one person can easily handle a four lane production line. This feature also supports the unit’s high operational speed – up to 200 sticks per minute per lane.

options.name: Combination trays
options.header: Broadening the range of possible products
options.body: Combination trays makes it possible to run different product types on the line without changing the trays on the worktable. The specially designed trays can be made to run up to 5 products on the same trays at varying capacities.

options.name: After cooler conveyor for stickles products
options.body: When producing ice cream bars and bite size pieces on an extrusion line, chocolate needs to dry and harden after chocolate enrobing. While this is often achieved by having an additional tunnel connected to the line, with the Tetra Pak® Extrusion Tunnel M3, it’s possible to run an after-cooler conveyor through the tunnel house.

options.name: Add-on and exchange modules
options.header: Enabling production of a broad range of ice creams
options.body: Whatever kind of ice cream you want to produce, there is an add-on module or modules to make it possible. Different stick product size and shape, full and half sandwiches, ice cream slices, candy bars, bite size, ball top cones, wafer cups, decorated cakes, logs etc.

benefits:
• Complete standalone plug & play unit that’s easy to manoeuvre
  • Ensures uniform product quality by keeping chocolate coating at a precise temperature +/- 2°
  • Delivers homogeneous coating and uniform results, even when applying a mixture of dry and liquid coatings
name: Tetra Pak® Pump Station centrifugal 100 M2

options.name: Water circulation system
options.body: A water pump circulates water in the tank’s water jacket, ensuring an even distribution of heated water throughout the tank. This keeps the coating inside the tank at the right temperature and enables consistent product quality with less chocolate giveaway.

options.name: Frequency inverter pump speed control
options.body: The viscosity of the product and the pump pressure together determine system speed. Thanks to this optional feature, pump capacity can be adjusted on the fly. In other words, the operator can visually control production results and, if necessary, increase circulation without stopping the equipment.

options.name: Remote control
options.header: Enabling on-demand feeding to e.g. dipping systems
options.body: When there is signal from the dipping system, the pump starts to refill it automatically. This means the operator no longer needs to start and stop the system, just to feed more coating matter into the pump station’s tank.

options.name: Dry stuff unit
options.body: A hopper with an Archimedes screw feeder is mounted on top of the pump station. The screw is equipped with a gear motor, making it possible to change the speed of the auger and adjust the amount of dry ingredients being delivered into the chocolate or other coating matter mix.

benefits:
• Based on components selected for their high serviceability, precision and durability
  • Exceptional product uniformity with optimal texture (< 0.7 % standard deviation)
  • Patented start-up procedure that minimizes waste

features.name: Space efficient design
features.header: How many litres product per m2
features.body: The selection of a highly compact motor and pulley system enable a narrow design, so it is possible to place several freezers side by side if needed. The internal piping is optimized to enhance space efficiency and serviceability – all of which results in an unusually high output for a footprint of only 1.72 m2 (CF 2000).

features.name: Rotary pump
features.header: For precise production and minimal waste
features.body: The most precise pumps on the market are used in this freezer, ensuring an accurate flow of product and guaranteeing production stability with repeatable results and low waste. The pumps are cleaned automatically during the freezer’s own CIP cycle.

features.name: IE3 and IE4 motors
features.body: Built with the most energy efficient motors, this unit keeps power consumption down to a minimum, thereby reducing running costs.

features.name: Patented cylinder design
features.body: This unit features a unique cylinder that enables a 10% increase in the heat transfer rate compared to older models of freezers. The outer diameter of the pipe remains identical, but the surface of the coolant channel is ribbed to maximize heat transfer.

features.name: Hygienic shaft seal
features.body: This shaft seal is made of hard metal steel in order to withstand production of mixtures with coarse particles without wearing out the components prematurely. It has a recommended replacement time is 3000 hours. To further enhance hygiene, the spring is placed outside the product zone, thereby preventing product from becoming trapped during production.

features.name: Operator control panel
features.body: A user-friendly touch screen panel shows operators what is happening in the individual unit and can be connected to the production control system, Tetra PlantMaster™ for an overall line view. This enables full production monitoring capabilities and access to a historic log for tracing production.

features.name: Patented start-up procedure
features.body: In traditional freezers, the first 2 to 3 batches of product are usually wasted due to inaccuracies in overrun. But with this model, the overrun is accurate from the start, leading to an upper limit of half a cylinder of product waste at start-up. This feature saves a significant amount of money on expensive ingredients.

features.name: Mass flow meter A2 series
features.body: A mass flow meter ensures that precisely the desired amount of air enters the freezing cylinder and is incorporated into the mixture. More or less air can be incorporated to vary product texture as needed, with minimal production fluctuations and hence minimal waste. The meter can handle up to 140% overrun, enabling products with a high air content.

name: Tetra Pak® Continuous Freezer A2 series

options.name: Multiple outlet pumps
options.header: Feed several product lanes without extra costs
options.body: Multiple outlet pumps make it possible to feed up to four product lanes with a single freezer, or eight lanes with two freezers, and still get a precise, consistent volume of product distributed into each container. With one freezer to feed up to four lanes of production you also reduce investment, start-up waste, spare parts and maintenance costs.

options.name: Dasher tray
options.header: Increases operator safety and protects your capital equipment
options.body: Uniquely, Tetra Pak® offers a pull-out tray which makes it possible to safely remove the dasher. It keeps the operators hands at a safe distance from the dasher’s sharp blades and prevents contact with the cylinder surface.

options.name: Cooling valves
options.body: With these cooling valves, there is no pressure drop across the valve. This enables a higher suction pressure and hence lower power needs.

options.name: Line integration
options.header: Minimizes operator interference and reduces running costs
options.body: A communication package that enables communication between the freezer and the downstream equipment. Shared recipe handling and production hold signals reduce the need for operator interference. Also, by sharing flow signals to downstream equipment like ingredients dosers, the use of ingredients can be optimized to the actual outlet flow from the freezer.

benefits:
• Exceptional and consistent product quality with smart features to detect deviations
  • Outstanding efficiency and low production costs, thanks to savings on wrapping material and high production speed
  • Recipe handling and several exchangeable modules enable highly flexible production

features.name: Integrated paper rack
features.body: The paper rack is mounted onto the machine rather than on an external rack. This reduces space requirements and makes it easy for operators to access the paper rolls and replace them, while minimizing friction. The lack of friction also enables the use of thinner wrapping material.

features.name: Quick release handle
features.header: Enables wrapping of different product types and sizes
features.body: Different paper formers are needed depending on the size and the shape of the product and wrapping material width. In this unit, there is a quick release handle, which makes it easy to switch paper formers (without tools) whenever a different product it going to be made.

features.name: Individual fin seal drive & sealing module
features.body: Designed with an individual fin seal drive and sealing module, this unit enables easy threading of one lane at a time. That means fast and safe product changes, with the minimum waste of wrapping material. It also enables the features called ‘no-product-no-wrapping’ and fast photo registration (or ‘picture in place’ wrapping).

features.name: Cross sealing & cutting module
features.body: This module moves in a box motion pattern, which means the wrapping material is held together for an optimal length of time and at the correct temperature to form a reliable seal. An integrated fast moving cutting device cuts the packaging material within the jaws during sealing.

features.name: Replaceable modules
features.body: The fin and cross seal modules are designed for fast replacement, with power outlets for air and power connections. Having an additional set of modules means you can remove one when a wear part needs replacing without prolonged interruption to your production. The switch typically takes ten minutes.

name: Tetra Pak® Multilane Wrapper 2200 A2

options.name: Paper break detection
options.body: If a reel of paper gets torn, the unit automatically stops the individual paper lane and alerts the operator so he/she can reconnect it. At the same time, it stops incoming products on that lane and exits them automatically before the in-feed to prevent a product pile up.

options.name: Choice of date coding options
options.body: This unit is compatible with a range of different date coding systems, including drop on demand, continuous inkjet, thermal inkjet and laser. The code is printed lengthways on the wrapper in the desired position.

options.name: Photo mark registration
options.header: Positions product correctly in the wrapper
options.body: This sensor ensures that the product is aligned with the printed design on the wrapper so that each wrapped product coming off the line looks the same. This option is also necessary for producers who want to decide exactly where the date code appears on the product.

options.name: Individual lane exit
options.body: An individual lane exit at the wrapper outlet allows non-conforming products and empty or joined wraps to be removed rather than being further conveyed for cartoning. The system detects certain non-conformities by itself; the operator can detect other issues and, if necessary, override the system.

header: Taking wrapping performance to a whole new level

benefits:
• A low investment wrapper for entry level customers or producers running smaller capacity lines
  • Quality wrapping and low waste thanks to photo mark registration (‘picture in place’) system
  • Can be easily manoevred to the area of the factory where it’s needed – perhaps serving two functions

features.name: Photo mark registration
features.header: Positions product correctly in the wrapper
features.body: This sensor ensures that the product is aligned with the printed design on the wrapper so that each wrapped product coming off the line looks the same. This also makes it possible for producers to decide exactly where the date code appears on the product.

features.name: Bottom sealing
features.header: Reliable, tight wrapping, even of larger products
features.body: The wrapping material comes down onto the product from above, and is sealed beneath the product. This method gives a quality seal, and a good-looking end product, regardless of size.

name: Tetra Pak® Singlelane Wrapper 254 M2

options.name: Automatic splicing
options.body: Two rolls of wrapping material are held above the conveyor. When one runs out, the first paper roll is spliced automatically to the second, and production continues uninterrupted. The operator can feed a new roll on to the machine at his/her own convenience.

header: Performance wrapping at a small start-up investment

benefits:
• Can be adapted easily to produce a broad range of products
  • Compact and robust design saves space and enables easy operation
  • Consistent product quality and low operational cost thanks to high precision coating

features.name: Overlapping grippers
features.body: The gripper head is equipped with up to 20 grippers. The grippers’ profiles overlap, which means they can pick up a product even if it is not positioned in precisely the correct spot. They also pick up everything from the trays - no product escapes! Used in both pick up and lay down, this feature is unique to Tetra Pak®’s dip and transfer unit.

features.name: Dipping system
features.body: The length and modular design of the dipping area means 16 dipping stations can be included in this unit. This makes it possible to produce ice cream products with lot of different coatings - chocolate, caramel, juice or other – individually or in combinations.

features.name: Chocolate tank
features.header: Coating precision reduces giveaway and saves money
features.body: Controlled from the dip and transfer unit, this tank keeps the chocolate or other coating matter at a steady temperature. Two pumps and agitators circulate the coating matter and keep the dipping cup topped up, so exactly the right amount of chocolate is applied to each ice cream, with minimal giveaway.

features.name: Dipping divisions
features.body: The coating tank can be split into up to four sections, each one equipped with a pump and an agitator. This makes it possible to coat four different products, with or without inclusions, and thereby create variety packs. A typical series of coatings might be dark chocolate, milk chocolate, white chocolate, and milk chocolate with split almond inclusions.

features.name: Dipping control system
features.body: Once set by the operator, the dipping speed, time and level are all automatically controlled by the recipe handling system. This ensures the correct amount of expensive ingredients such as chocolate are applied - no more no less – and that the process is perfectly repeatable.

features.name: Level control sensor
features.body: A sensor in the chocolate tank monitors the base level of coating matter and alerts the operator when it is time to re-feed the tank. This helps ensure both a steady supply and steady temperature, which keeps production on target.

features.name: Lay down system
features.header: Enhances food safety and wrapping accuracy
features.body: This servo driven system is designed to gently place the product in exactly the right position on the paper lane. In addition, it lays down the product in one position at a time, enabling the ‘no-product, no-wrap feature’ of our wrapping machines. The absence of contact with human hands also eliminates contamination risks.

name: Tetra Pak® Dip and Transfer unit A2

options.name: Light curtain
options.body: Positioned between the two ends of the dipping sections, the light curtain acts as an invisible door. When the light panel is broke, the machine stops automatically. This enhances safety and hygiene without limiting visibility or requiring cleaning. Restart takes under 1 minute.

options.name: Multi-dip stations
options.body: When coating ice creams with e.g. juice or multilayer chocolate, the challenge is to get a thick coating across the whole product. This is achieved with our add-on Multi-dip option, which allows the product to be dipped several times in the same tank, and thereby lengthens the total amount of coating time.

options.name: Coating control
options.header: Ensures the correct ratio between dry and liquid coating matter
options.body: A mass flow meter at the chocolate inlet measures the chocolate flow into an external mixing tank. Meanwhile, the dry stuff dosing unit measures the dry stuff feed (e.g. split almonds). Working in unison, they ensure the correct ratio of dry and liquid coating products in the mix. This gives an even distribution of coatings and saves money on expensive ingredients.

options.name: Extra tank
options.body: When switching from one type of coating matter to another, it only takes one minute to exchange dipping tanks. Having an extra tank available saves waiting time for cleaning. It is especially valuable when producing ice cream coated with nuts, since no traces of a nut coated product may appear in a product without nuts.

options.name: Exchange parts
options.body: An optional set of pick-up grippers, lamellas and lay down grippers makes it possible to go from e.g. production of ice cream sticks to sandwich, ball top cone or wafer cups, or from production of one size of product to another. Each set is optimized for a specific product. Pick-up heads for transferring to the conveyor for chocolate enrobing of sandwiches, ice cream slices, candy bars and bite size products are also available as options.

options.name: Dry coating function
options.body: This optional unit it used to produce ice cream sticks and ball top cones which have the dry coating on the outside of the chocolate, rather than mixed into it.

header: Efficient dipping unit for low total cost

benefits:
• Highly reliable, high performance unit, with 100+ machines in operation worldwide
  • Accurate and hygienic operation thanks to a single piece conveyor belt
  • Each process step is designed to ensure the gentle handling of sticks and thereby minimize waste

features.name: Backup stick magazine
features.body: If the stick supply is interrupted by, for example, an off-spec stick, a built-in sensor detects the lack of motion and activates the back-up stick magazine instead. This occurs without any break in production.

features.name: High capacity stacker (multi)
features.body: The high capacity stacker takes the sticks from the boxes and neatly organises them into the vertical feeding stack. This makes it possible to insert 42 000 sticks per hour, or up to 30 strokes per minute.

features.name: Servo controlled belt
features.body: The combination of servo controls with precisely positioned grooves on the belt makes it possible to catch the sticks and deliver them in exactly the right position, even at very high speeds.

features.name: Insertion mechanism
features.body: This feature reduces the unit’s sensitivity to deviations in operating parameters. Even if the stick is not inserted in the perfect position on the mould table, it will still be positioned correctly in the product for pick-up, and the machine will continue to function.

features.name: User-friendly operator panel
features.body: Pre-set recipes for each product are stored in the control system, so operating staff just have to press a single button at start-up. The system continuously monitors stacking and dispensing operations, and sounds the alarm if – for example - a stick is missing. The operator can then immediately address the problem, and production continues with the support of the back up magazine.

name: Tetra Pak® Automatic Stick multi

options.name: Feeding arch and dispensing belt module
options.body: The standard feeding arch and dispensing belt module can be switched to an optional one equipped to handle sticks of a different length or width.

options.name: Round stick dispensing module
options.header: Enables the use of cylindrical sticks
options.body: The standard feeding arch is replaced with a round stick dispensing module, which is a manually filled magazine, making it possible to apply cylindrical shaped sticks.

benefits:
• Lets you make the full range of products, from basic to premium
  • Full servo controlled line optimizes production efficiency and accuracy
  • High speed equipment enables a competitive product price

features.name: Adaptable filling
features.header: Enables a broad variety of different products
features.body: The moulder can be fitted with a volumetric top filler, a volumetric bottom filler, a time elapse top filler, a pencil filler and back suction equipment. By changing the filling method (or sequence of filling methods) it is possible - and relatively simple - to produce an almost infinite variety of products. Pre-set recipes in the automation system recognise and adapt to the filling method that is in place at any given time.

features.name: Extractor tong
features.header: Enhances the reliability of your production
features.body: This small but vital component takes hold of the ice cream stick and pulls the product up out of the mould. It can adapt automatically to find the stick, and pulled it up with sufficient force to guarantee the product is removed and never dropped. Typically a wear part, this tong has a documented lifetime of approximately 10 years, and is used in both rotary and linear moulding lines.

features.name: Tong surveillance sensor M 35 A2
features.header: Monitors production and enables rapid corrective action
features.body: The sensor checks that a product is always pulled up out of the mould when it should be. If it does not detect a product, the operator is alerted and can make adjustments. A signal is also sent to the wrapper, telling it to wait for a product to arrive rather than creating an empty wrap. All errors are logged and, if they point to the same tong, a replacement can quickly be installed.

features.name: Superior mould table 35 A2
features.header: For maximum durability and product safety
features.body: Our ice cream moulds are designed, manufactured and quality assured in order to withstand the harsh production environment and stress caused by frequent temperature fluctuations, all without jeopardising product quality and safety.

features.name: Nozzle plate 35 A2
features.header: Ensures consistent product quality and low costs
features.body: Brine is pumped at -40 through the nozzles of the nozzle plate, ensuring contact with the entire surface of the mould. This carefully designed process gives very efficient heat transfer, making production economical and ensuring reliable product quality.

features.name: Five servo drives 35 A2
features.body: The unit carries out a series of different actions: indexing of the moulds, extraction of the product, indexing of the tongs, dipping and lay down. Thanks to five built-in servo drives, the timing of these different actions can be controlled down to the millisecond, which is what makes reliable high speed production possible.

features.name: Lay down system M 35 A2
features.header: Enhances food safety and wrapping accuracy
features.body: This servo driven system is designed to gently place the product in exactly the right position on the paper lane. There is no need for contact with human hands, which eliminates the risk of contamination. In addition, it lays down the product in one position at a time, enabling the ‘no-product no-wrap feature’ of our wrapping machines.

name: Tetra Pak® Rotary Moulder 35 A2

options.name: Storage carriage
options.header: For storing and transporting mould segments
options.body: With the capacity to hold five segments each, these carriages are useful for transporting and storing moulds safely when using another set to create a different product shape. The storage carriage holds the moulds at an angle so the water drains off after cleaning.

options.name: Dry coater
options.body: Dry coating is a critical process. If not handled correctly it can lead to errors, waste of expensive ingredients and down time. This optional new generation dry coater can be emptied on the fly, enabling production to continue uninterrupted, even if the chocolate is not at exactly the right temperature - such as, during the start-up phase.

options.name: Combi Top Filler
options.header: Expands the range of possible filled products
options.body: Available in either a pneumatic or servo driven version, this equipment makes it possible to produce water ice, Ice cream and slush ice, and to have inclusions. It also enables filling with two colours - either two per mould or two per row. The volume of filled product can be easily adjusted between production runs.

options.name: Tetra Pak® Volumetric Bottom Filler
options.header: For high quality moulded ice creams
options.body: Enabling a greater amount of air to be incorporated in your viscous filled products, this filler lets you produce high quality moulded ices with a premium feel. It can also handle larger inclusions up to 15mm, and with filling at down to -5°C, the inclusions remain evenly distributed throughout the product. A cold start temperature reduces the time required in the rotary moulder, thereby increasing line capacity.

options.name: Tetra Pak® Automatic Stick Multi
options.body: A servo driven conveyor belt prepares the sticks so they can be inserted in precisely the correct position in the product, thus enabling reliable performance and high yield. The unit runs at up to 30 strokes per minute and can also be equipped with a backup magazine so production continues uninterrupted, even if a stick is off spec.

header: High capacity moulding with product versatility

benefits:
• Three layout options make it easy to integrate this moulder into an existing production facility
  • 10,000 products/hr is possible thanks to the mechanically driven linear extractor
  • Handling to a multilane wrapper enhances hygiene

features.name: Superior mould table
features.header: For maximum durability and product safety
features.body: Our ice cream moulds are designed, manufactured and quality assured in order to withstand the harsh production environment and stress caused by frequent temperature fluctuations, all without jeopardising product quality and safety.

features.name: Extractor tong
features.header: Enhances the reliability of your production
features.body: This small but vital component takes hold of the ice cream stick and pulls the product up out of the mould. It can adapt automatically to find the stick, and pulled it up with sufficient force to guarantee the product is removed and never dropped. Typically a wear part, this tong has a documented lifetime of approximately 10 years, and is used in both rotary and linear moulding lines.

features.name: Linear extractor
features.header: Increases production speed and enhances hygiene
features.body: By lengthening the drying time after dipping, this extractor makes dry coating possible. It also enables the use of a multilane wrapper and consequently enhanced hygiene - from laying down the product by only touching the stick.

features.name: Mechanical drive 23/27 M2
features.body: Designed to perform a precise sequence of movements, the mechanical drive on the extractor gives you reliable cam driven extraction, indexing, dipping and lay down.

features.name: Two wrapper options
features.body: The single lay down is for a gentle and direct lay down into the pocket conveyor, and the gripper only ever touches the stick. The double lay down is for direct transfer to the multilane wrapper. It further enhances hygiene by putting the stick directly onto the wrapping paper without any intermediate steps.

features.name: Two single laydown options
features.body: The grippers can be positioned in two different ways, depending on whether you want the product laid down with the stick facing backwards or forwards. This gives you the flexibility to choose between three different line layouts. It also determines the layout of the singelane wrapper outlet.

features.name: Nozzle plate 23/27 M2
features.header: Ensures consistent product quality, and low costs
features.body: Brine is pumped at -40°C through the nozzles of the nozzle plate, ensuring contact with the entire surface of the mould. This carefully designed process gives the best possible heat transfer effect, making production economical and ensuring reliable product quality.

features.name: Adaptable filling 23 M2
features.header: Enables production of a variety of different products
features.body: This moulder can be fitted with a volumetric top filler, a time elapse top filler, a time elapse pencil filler and back suction equipment. By changing the filling method (or sequence of filling methods) it is possible - and relatively simple - to produce a variety of products. Pre-set recipes in the automation system recognise and adapt to the filling method that is in place at any given time.

name: Tetra Pak® Rotary Moulder 23 M2

options.name: Electric brine heater
options.header: In the absence of a steam supply
options.body: When there is no steam system at the production plant, an electric heater can be placed in the reservoir underneath the tank. This serves to heat the brine, which enables easy extraction from the mould.

options.name: Tong surveillance sensor
options.header: Monitors production and enables rapid corrective action
options.body: The sensor checks that a product is always pulled up out of the mould when it should be. If it does not detect a product, the operator is alerted and can make adjustments. To enable the ‘no-product no-wrap’ feature, a signal is sent to the wrapper telling it to wait for a product to arrive rather than creating an empty wrap. All errors are logged and, if they point to the same tong, a replacement can quickly be installed.

options.name: Storage carriage
options.header: For storing and transporting mould segments
options.body: With the capacity to hold five segments each, these carriages are useful for transporting and storing moulds safely when using another set to create a different product shape. The storage carriage holds the moulds at an angle so the water drains off after cleaning.

options.name: Dry coater 23M2
options.body: Dry coating is a critical process. If not handled correctly it can lead to errors, waste of expensive ingredients and down time. This optional new generation dry coater can be emptied on the fly, enabling production to continue uninterrupted, even if the chocolate is not at exactly the right temperature - such as, during the start-up phase.

header: High performance moulding with low start up cost

benefits:
• Highly reliable, high performance unit, with 100+ machines in operation worldwide
  • Gentle handling of sticks even at high speeds, minimizes waste
  • Hygienic operation as sticks are automatically transferred from the hopper to the magazine

features.name: High capacity stacker (single)
features.body: The high capacity stacker takes the sticks from the boxes and neatly organizes them into the vertical feeding stack. This makes it possible to insert over 200 sticks per minute, per lane

features.name: Inserter mechanism
features.body: The slide pusher drive mechanism has an open design to prevent dust from building up and so secure the highest possible availability and yield.

features.name: User-friendly operator panel (single)
features.body: Pre-set recipes for each product are stored in the control system, so operating staff just have to press a single button at start-up. The system continuously monitors stacking and dispensing operations, and sounds the alarm if – for example – a stick is missing. The operator can then immediately address the problem, or the system will pull this lane out of operation.

name: Tetra Pak® Automatic Stick single

options.name: Stick inserter
options.header: For gentle handling during stick insertion
options.body: A pneumatic drive is standard in this unit, but it can also be delivered with a patented servo controlled stick inserter drive. This enables full control over insertion speeds and forces, even at high speeds. It also consumes less power and prevents sticks from getting damaged.

options.name: Feeding arch and dispensing magazine
options.body: The standard feeding arch and dispensing magazine can be switched to an optional one equipped to handle sticks of a different length or width.

options.name: Modular design
options.body: Two modules can be placed close together, without hindering operator access. For example, the magazines can be placed to the left or right in relation to the extrusion station – or even placed behind a wall outside the wet zone.

benefits:
• Product flexibility and quick changeovers, without jeopardising quality
