  • Costs minimized by high yield dispensing of cones, cups and lids; low give-away on chocolate spraying and ice cream filling
  • Efficient freezer and accurate ingredients doser combine to ensure low TCO

features.name: Cone dispenser
features.body: This dispenser is designed to operate reliably even when the cones used are not the highest quality or have, for example, folded edges. The cones are separated and dispensed from the stack, rather than being allowed to drop. This controlled action prevents the cones sticking together, as well as eliminating a number of other common problems.

features.name: Accurate chocolate sprayer
features.body: Thanks to individual volumetric dosing, exactly the right amount of chocolate is sprayed into each cone. Just enough to chocolate can be used to coat the cone and protect it from moisture, but no more. An airless spray nozzle ensures an even distribution of chocolate.

features.name: Modular filling valve system
features.header: Enables production of many different products
features.body: basic set up is a side-by-side filler for two flavours of ice cream with inclusions up to 10mm. With additional modules, these two flavours can be combined in a variety of ways. For example, in concentric, windmill, swirl, core ripple and outside ripple patterns - all with or without inclusions. The filling valve can of course run just one flavour as well.

features.name: Exchangeable nozzles
features.header: Easy to produce a range of filling patterns
features.body: The filling nozzles are clamped on, and are to swap when you want to make a different filling pattern. For example, smooth surface, fluted surface, swirled surface, and swirled with ripple. Multi-rosette nozzles are also available for decorative effects.

features.name: Dynamic distribution
features.header: Gives high dosing accuracy with low giveaway
features.body: The incoming ice cream is agitated while being divided into the number of lanes needed for filling. This, combined with highly accurate fill valve control ensures that exactly the right amount of ice cream is fed into each cone or cup, with a standard deviation below 1.5%.

features.name: Valve with back suction
features.header: Enables wet top decoration without quality issues
features.body: Individual top decoration valves with back suction make it possible to decorate your product with fruit sauce or chocolate, without drips. From a pump station the liquid is fed to the valves and dosed with a nozzle for a controlled amount of time. When ready, the last drops are sucked back into the nozzle to prevent mess.

features.name: Lid dispenser
features.body: Suction cups pick up the lids individually from a vertical magazine. Both the suction cups and the magazine itself are quick and easy to swap when you want to change to a different type and/or size of lid.

features.name: Cone sleeve crimper
features.header: Locks the cone lid in position
features.body: When the lid has been placed inside the top of the cone sleeve, the lid crimper folds the paper down around the edges. It presses the excess paper firmly enough to lock it in position, so there is not risk of the lid coming loose. There is a crimping head for each lane, optimised – together with the lamella inserts - for the exact lid size.

name: Tetra Pak® Ice Cream Filler A3

options.name: Exchangeable modules
options.header: Enables production of cups, tops and squeeze-up tubes
options.body: By adding and removing certain modules, it becomes possible to make other products. If producing cups or tubs, a cup or tub dispenser replaces the cone dispenser. A pressing device– the equivalent of a crimping device for cones - is used to click the lids in place. On the other hand, a chocolate sprayer is not needed.

options.name: Dry ingredient dozer
options.body: A large range of dry ingredients can be dosed on top of the ice cream filling and topping sauce. The volume is “time-elapse” adjustable from the recipe.

options.name: Printer system
options.header: Enabling date coding on all products
options.body: A carriage module enables the printer head to move across the product lamella and thus pass all lanes for each index. The printer - typically an ink-jet system – can print the desired text in up to three lanes.

options.name: Pick and place device
options.header: For gentle product transfer at high speeds
options.body:
In order to transfer products even more safely and efficiently to the hardening tunnel, you can exchange the belt outlet conveyor for a pick-and-place device. When defining the interface, the difference in distance between products at the ‘pick up’ and ‘place’ positions is fully flexible. The trailing movement is also synchronized with the tray tunnel to secure gentle product handling.

When we transfer with a Pick & place, we take an array of typically 4 x 6 cone products and move them from the filling machine over to the tray tunnel (extrusion line). The challenge is that the distance (pitch) between the products is not the same in the ‘pick-up’ position as in the ‘place’ position. Therefore the array changes distance between the products in 1 or maybe 2 directions, and they are always moved closer together in that transfer.

benefits:
• Makes it possible to produce moulded ice creams with a premium feel and an even distribution of large inclusions
  • Dynamic distribution and accurate servo-controlled dosing keep giveaway to an absolute minimum
  • Servo controls enable a wide range of product types and sizes

features.name: Direct product feeding
features.body: This is a pressurized system, as opposed to an open hopper, which means that colder product can be fed into the dosing cylinders. A colder product means more even distribution of inclusions, which neither float nor sink. A lower temperature also means higher overrun, and higher line capacity are possible.

features.name: Enclosed system
features.header: Enhances hygiene, saves time and labour
features.body: The system is completely enclosed, and designed to enable full Cleaning in Place (CIP). Automatic cleaning is more reliable than manual cleaning, and it saves time and effort, since there is no need to dismantle and reassemble the system.

features.name: Dynamic distribution
features.header: Gives high dosing accuracy with low giveaway
features.body: The incoming ice cream is agitated while being divided into the number of lanes needed for filling. This, combined with highly accurate fill valve control ensures that exactly the right amount of ice cream is fed into each cone or cup, with a standard deviation below 1.5%.

features.name: Modular setup
features.header: Enables range of different sizes and shapes
features.body: Filling speeds, timings and dosing volumes are all servo controlled. This makes it possible to achieve any product’s volume and shape (within the range of the module) according to a pre-set recipe. Lot’s of different products can be made, without changing any mechanical parts.

features.name: Dosing valve design
features.header: Enables moulded products with large inclusions
features.body: Large openings in the dosing valve enable hard inclusions of up to 15 mm, and soft inclusions of up to 20 mm. Thanks to this innovation, inclusion size is no longer limited by the bottom filler, only by the design of the mould.

name: Tetra Pak® Volumetric Bottom Filler

options.name: Double set of dosing pistons and nozzle design
options.header: Enables several combinations of two flavours
options.body: If producing an ice cream with two flavours, a double set of dosing pistons can handle each flavour individually. This means you can have different amounts of each flavour, and combine the flavours in different ways: side by side, one inside the other, one on top of the other, or in a zebra pattern.

header: For premium quality moulded ice creams

benefits:
• Exceptional product uniformity with optimal texture (< 2 % standard deviation)
  • Easy installation thanks to self contained refrigeration system
  • Production system designed for accurate and repeatable output

features.name: Mass flow meter
features.body: A mass flow meter ensures that precisely the desired amount of air enters the freezing cylinder and is incorporated into the mixture. More or less air can be incorporated to vary product texture as needed, with minimal production fluctuations and hence minimal waste. The meter can handle up to 140% overrun, enabling products with a high air content.

features.name: IE3 motors
features.body: Built with the most energy efficient motors, this unit keeps power consumption down to a minimum, thereby reducing running costs.

features.name: Space efficient design
features.body: Thanks to the choice of a modern, space efficient compressor and optimized piping, this freezer offers an unusually high output for a small footprint (1.25 m2)

features.name: Rotary pumps
features.header: Gives precise production and minimises waste
features.body: The most precise pumps on the market are used in this freezer, ensuring an accurate flow of product and guaranteeing production stability with repeatable results and low waste. The pumps are cleaned automatically during the freezer’s own CIP cycle.

features.name: Hygienic shaft seal
features.body: The shaft seal is designed for ease of cleaning and to prevent product becoming trapped during production. This enables prolonged running time between cleaning without jeopardising food safety, and consequently has a positive impact on your bottom line.

features.name: Operator control panel
features.body: A user-friendly touch screen shows operators what is happening and enables storage of up to 100 different product recipes. Since the machine doesn’t have to be fine-tuned before each new production run, start-up process is quick and efficient. It also means that staff can operate the machine with minimal training.

name: Tetra Pak® Continuous Freezer S700 A2

options.name: Dual outlet pumps
options.header: Feed product lanes without extra costs
options.body: With dual outlet pumps, you can feed two product lanes from a single freezer, or four lanes from two freezers, and still get a precise, consistent volume of product distributed into each container. Start-up waste, spare parts and maintenance costs are all reduced by 50 %.

options.name: Variable dasher speed
options.body: This option is designed for producers with special requirements. For example, a product that needs to be whipped harder than usual, or perhaps a high-end product, which requires fine-tuned agitation for optimized texture and mouth feel. By manually adjusting the speed, it is possible to get the desired result and save energy at the same time.

options.name: Heavy-duty shaft seal kits
options.body: Choose a shaft seal made of hard metal steel in order to withstand production of mixtures with coarse particles without wearing out the components prematurely. It offers up to 3000 hours of wear life, which is approximately three times the length that of a standard shaft seal

benefits:
• Achieve efficient, flexible mixing at a low total cost of ownership
  • Add ingredients quickly, easily at floor level
  • Minimize powder and concentrate waste

features.name: Patented coaxial injection technology
features.header: Fast in-feed of powder and concentrate at floor level
features.body: The coaxial injector enables fast in-feed of powder and concentrate directly into the stream at floor level and mixing begins immediately in the injector. The flowing liquid creates under pressure due to the Bernoulli effect. This sucks the powder into the mixer, thereby minimizing dust in the in feed, eliminating the requirement of a fan or blower and minimizing maintenance needs. It also prevents clogging since the added ingredients never change direction.

features.name: Radial jet technology
features.header: Symmetrical mixing field for efficient, homogenous mixing
features.body: Radial jet technology works with the coaxial injector to minimize air incorporation and foaming thanks to calm, even mixing that enables instant wetting of powders, fast dissolving and homogenous distribution – without creating a vortex at the surface.

features.name: Smart, ergonomic operator table
features.header: Add powder and liquid ingredients at floor level
features.body: The smart, ergonomic operator table lets operators work on the floor to add ingredients at floor level from sacks, big bags and various kinds of concentrate containers quickly and easily – with an ergonomic and automated solution and a large operational friendly HMI. It also enables easy water rinsing of the funnel and concentrate barrels with a water gun, ensuring that no powder or concentrate goes to waste during addition. The floor level operation minimizes investment cost since no screw conveyor, pneumatic system or platform required for adding ingredients.

name: Tetra Pak® Mixer RJCI

options.name: BigBag adapter
options.body: The BigBag adapter enables the connection of BigBags for more efficient handling of large amounts of powder ingredients.

options.name: Drum emptying solutions
options.header: Choose the drum emptying solution that fits your application
options.body: Our optional drum emptying solutions make it possible to empty all kinds of liquid concentrates, up to 10,000cP.

header: Efficient addition and mixing of powders and concentrates

benefits:
• Handles a wide range of products
  • Enables simple, flexible production
  • Maintains consistent high product quality

features.name: Production flexibility
features.header: Balancing capacity between pasteurizer and filling system
features.body: Buffering low to high viscous products with or without particles, with or without agitator, to avoid product losses and recirculation.

name: High Hygiene Tank

features.name: Horizontal tank with agitator
features.body: When blending low to high viscous products with or without particles, a horizontal tank with agitator is the recommended solution.

benefits:
• Minimize investment and operational costs with smart hydraulic sugar conveying solution
• Flexibly place your sugar dissolver for more flexible plant layout
• Reduce energy consumption and cost by 25% with lower dissolving temperature
• Get guaranteed °Brix accuracy for exact dosing

features.name: Injector and radial jet mixer technology
features.body:
Our patented injector system enables hydraulic conveying but it also reduces energy consumption overall. Due to the immediate wetting of sugar and the high turbulence as soon as the sugar touches the water stream.

Once the sugar has passed the injection point, it is conveyed hydraulically to a radial jet mixer, which provides enough turbulence inside the dissolving tank to keep the sugar crystals in abeyance and dissolve them efficiently. This allows us to lower the dissolving temperature and, thus, the energy consumption.

features.name: Flexible integration and placement
features.header: Hydraulic conveying enables flexibility in layout
features.body:
Hydraulic conveying lets you locate sugar feeding points independently from where your dissolver is located. This lets you handle several types of feeding equipment. It’s equally easy to take sugar in directly from a silo, BigBag station or even a feeding hopper.

On top of that, you can choose to include more than one feeding point in an iterative process into the recirculation line. Since you can place the Tetra Pak® Continuous Sugar Dissolver in an independent area, you no longer need to worry about ATEX requirements for the dissolving unit itself, thus saving you from having to make additional investments.

features.name: Advanced °Brix set point control
features.header: Maintains a constant °Brix level – saves energy and raw materials
features.body: Since this unit constantly measures the sugar concentration directly inline, you always have full control of the water to sugar ratio. Rather than overdosing and diluting at a later stage, this solution maintains the optimal temperature for the exact amount of sugar you need to dissolve – thereby saving energy and raw materials. Since the process is continuous and eliminates the need for manual sampling, it also saves on operator time.

features.name: Automatic filling in destination tank
features.body: Automatic filling makes the Tetra Pak® Continuous Sugar Dissolver very easy to operate. When the sugar solution is at the right °Brix, the flow is automatically diverted to the destination tank. When the destination tank is full, the Tetra Pak® Continuous Sugar Dissolver stops. As the sugar solution is pumped away for use in production, the level drops and an operator can start up the Tetra Pak® Continuous Sugar Dissolver again. Alternatively, it can be controlled automatically.

name: Tetra Pak® Continuous Sugar Dissolver
header: Smart, flexible solution with hydraulic conveying

benefits:
• Guaranteed carbonation performance up to 20 °C enables a broad range of products
  • Fully automated process ensures uniform product quality and food safety
  • Features such as the eco vacuum pump and packed bed deaerator reduce operational costs

features.name: Up to 5 ingredients streams
features.body: One of the keys to success in liquid mixing is the ability to formulate a broad variety of products cost-effectively. Making 5 ingredients streams available (though they do not all have to be used), Tetra Pak® In-line Blender B offers a simple way to vary your recipes.

features.name: Deaerator
features.body: A deaerator is a needed in order to carbonate a product. Our deaerator uses a packed bed solution - unlike traditional models that circulate water over a double vessel vacuum system. This eliminates the need for a further pump for circulation and gas injection in order to reach the required oxygen content.

features.name: Pressurized tank
features.header: Keeps the bubbles in the system
features.body: How do you make sure the bubbles in your carbonated product don’t disappear? Maintaining the product under high pressure in the pressurized tank ensures that the carbon dioxide – which is dissolved in the product – does not disperse into the air. This tank also doubles up as a buffer tank and holds product safely during filling machine downtime.

features.name: Automatic Mass Compensation
features.body: AMC is the software that controls the amount of ingredients being added to Tetra Pak® In-line Blender B, and ensures that the outgoing °Brix level is correct throughout its run time. At the start, when the °Brix values of added ingredients such as syrup and concentrate are known, the amount required in each ingredient stream is calculated. If the amount added during production differs from this, the AMC instantly corrects it. Since checks occur 4-5 times per second, you can rest assured your process is on target.

features.name: Built-in eco vacuum pump
features.body: With the help of a built-in eco vacuum pump, the deaerator system works at very low pressure to reduce oxygen levels down to 0.5 ppm. Through the reuse of seal water, it successfully reduces the equipment’s water consumption to just 600l/h.

name: Tetra Pak® In-line Blender B with carbonation
header: Increase profitability with continuous CSD production

benefits:
• A space- and cost efficient way to produce a broad range of final syrup blends
  • Continuous blending and automatic recipe monitoring reduce the need for manual sampling and save preparation time
  • Full automation ensures uniform product quality and food safety

features.name: QC inline measurements
features.body: A sensor continuously monitors the °Brix /density of product in the buffer tank and feeds information to the unit’s control system. Should the values go outside the norm, the flow of ingredients is automatically corrected. This system guarantees precise production with standard deviation of +/- 3 Sigma, so product leaving the buffer tank is always correct and the same. It also reduces the need for manual product sampling, thereby saving operator time.

features.name: Automatic Mass Compensation
features.body: AMC is the software that controls the amount of ingredients being added to Tetra Pak® In-line Blender B, and ensures that the outgoing °Brix level is correct throughout its run time. At the start, when the °Brix values of added ingredients such as syrup and concentrate are known, the amount required in each ingredient stream is calculated. If the amount added during production differs from this, the AMC instantly corrects it. Since checks occur 4-5 times per second, you can rest assured your process is on target.

features.name: Up to 5 ingredients streams
features.body: One of the keys to success in liquid mixing is the ability to formulate a broad variety of products cost-effectively. Making 5 ingredients streams available (though they do not all have to be used), Tetra Pak® In-line Blender B offers a simple way to vary your recipes.

name: Tetra Pak® In-line Blender B for final syrup
header: Increase profitability with continuous production of final syrup

benefits:
• A cost-efficient way to produce lots of different liquid blends
  • Multiple recovery system minimizes product waste
  • Continuous blending and automatic recipe monitoring reduce the need for manual sampling and save preparation time

features.name: QC inline measurements
features.body: A sensor continuously monitors the °Brix /density of product in the buffer tank and feeds information to the unit’s control system. Should the values go outside the norm, the flow of ingredients is automatically corrected. This system guarantees precise production with standard deviation of +/- 3 Sigma, so product leaving the buffer tank is always correct and the same. It also reduces the need for manual product sampling, thereby saving operator time.

features.name: Buffer tank
features.body: The optional buffer tank makes it possible to even out the differences between product made at the start and end of a run, which might otherwise differ in composition. If the filler stops, the buffer tank enables production to continue for a certain period of time. It also enables the product recovery functions described in ‘Product recovery system’.

features.name: Automatic Mass Compensation
features.body: AMC is the software that controls the amount of ingredients being added to Tetra Pak® In-line Blender B, and ensures that the outgoing °Brix level is correct throughout its run time. At the start, when the °Brix values of added ingredients such as syrup and concentrate are known, the amount required in each ingredient stream is calculated. If the amount added during production differs from this, the AMC instantly corrects it. Since checks occur 4-5 times per second, you can rest assured your process is on target.

features.name: Up to 5 ingredients streams
features.body: One of the keys to success in liquid mixing is the ability to formulate a broad variety of products cost-effectively. Making 5 ingredients streams available (though they do not all have to be used), Tetra Pak® In-line Blender B offers a simple way to vary your recipes.

features.name: Product recovery system
features.body: A recovery system captures diluted product from the mix phase and any other non-approved product. It feeds this back to the Tetra Pak® In-line Blender B for final beverage, and corrects the blend so no product is wasted. It also recovers any concentrate that remains in the pipes leading to the premix tank at the end of a production run. If stops occur downstream, the same recovery system is activated and ‘lost’ product fed back to the Tetra Pak® In-line Blender B for final beverage unit, eliminating the need for a separate saviour tank.

name: Tetra Pak® In-line Blender B for final beverage

options.name: Deaerator
options.body: A deaerator is a needed in order to carbonate a product. Our deaerator uses a packed bed solution - unlike traditional models that circulate water over a double vessel vacuum system. This eliminates the need for a further pump for circulation and gas injection in order to reach the required oxygen content.

benefits:
• Low overall heat load minimizes impact on taste, colour and nutritional value
    • Suitable for a wide range of dairy and plant-based products
    • Highest operational efficiency for direct UHT systems on the market

features.name: Steam injection
features.body: Steam is injected rapidly into the product, instant heating it from 80° to the UHT temperature, followed by condensation (only 0.1 seconds) and temperature equilibrium. The combination of a high sterilization temperature and a short heating time ensures that microorganisms and spores are deactivated with minimal impact on the product's taste and colour. The process also involves very low fouling, which in turn means outstanding clean-ability, less downtime for cleaning and overall lower cleaning costs.

features.name: Steam infusion
features.header: Minimizes impact on product taste, colour and consistency
features.body: The basic principle of steam infusion is to heat a product by passing it through an atmosphere of steam. The product's spreading system may vary, but the resulting milk droplet size must be uniform, to maintain a steady heat transfer rate. The steam infusion process is similar to steam injection system but gentler (less shear) which gives greater product stability. It is therefore especially good for whipping cream and products containing stabilizers. However, it requires more steam, cooling water and additional product losses which leads to a 4 – 8 % higher operating cost than steam injection.

features.name: Flash-cooling
features.header: Minimal product losses, efficient operation and maintenance
features.body:
Flash cooling – which takes place in the condenser-equipped vacuum vessel - enables rapid cooling of the product. Partial vacuum is maintained by a pump and controlled to ensure the same amount of water is evaporated as was earlier added as steam. The large diameter and the conical shaped top, in combination with the long distance between the product inlet and vapour outlet ensure low carry over and minimal loss of flavour.

The compact vacuum vessel with built-in condenser gives you quick and efficient pre-sterilization and cleaning. It is also designed for easy access for inspection, service and maintenance.

features.name: Double balance tank system
features.body: There is one tank for product and another for water. The latter – a CIP header batch tank - is used as a second water tank at water-to-product change over, enabling a sharp water-to-product interface. In addition, a reduced bottom diameter shortens the mix phase. Volume-controlled filling and emptying minimise product losses to less than 150 litres per production run of 15,000 litres.

features.name: Heat exchanger protective panels
features.body: Protective panels built around the Tetra Pak® Tubular Heat Exchanger encapsulate the equipment and contain the heat. This gives up to 6% savings on energy consumption. With added insulation, savings go up to 11%. The panels also increase operator safety since they reduce the risk of contact with hot surfaces.

features.name: Heat exchanger floating protection system
features.body: Aseptic product in the inner tubes of the Tetra Pak® Tubular Heat Exchanger flows at a higher pressure than the untreated product on the shell side. A floating protection system allows for thermal expansion, greatly reducing the risk of damage from cracking, and consequent loss of sterility. In addition to extending lifetime, this improves food safety.

features.name: Combined heating solution
features.body: Instead of buying two different units, you can purchase a readymade combi model or upgrade your existing equipment to manage both direct and indirect heating methods. When producing premium products, the VTIS mode (direct UHT) gives optimal taste and colour. When producing a variety of products (i.e. both standard and premium quality) it is possible to run the equipment in Flex mode (indirect heating) or Plus mode (combining direct and indirect heating) and thereby lower utilities costs.

features.name: Automatic damper
features.body: Homogenizer dampers absorb pressure variation and shocks before and after the homogenizer. Automatic air refill maintains the air cushion in the homogenizer damper to ensure smooth operation. Without the air cushion, vibration and cavitation would occur and shorten the running time. Fully automated CIP is included - increasing operator safety, improving hygiene, and further optimizing the production cycle.

name: Tetra Therm® Aseptic VTIS

benefits:
• Low energy consumption, thanks to a rapid response hibernation system and compact unit design
  • Numerous features support food safety, before and during production
  • An automation system controls the operation of this unit and connected submodules, enabling efficient production

features.name: Divert system
features.body: The temperature of the product is verified both before and after the holding cell. Product can only continue out of the pasteurizer if it has been heated to the right temperature and held for the right length of time in the holding cell. If this is not the case, a signal is automatically sent to the divert valve, and the product is diverted back to the balance tank for recirculation.

features.name: Pressure differential
features.body: Booster pumps create a differential pressure between the pasteurized and unpasteurized side of the unit. To further enhance safety, this differential can be monitored by pressure transmitters. If these transmitters 'notice' that the differential has not been maintained, the product is automatically diverted back to the balance tank for recirculation.

features.name: Automatic hibernation
features.body: During water circulation, the flow in the pasteurizer can be decreased, the cooling can be stopped and most connected sub-modules can be switched off. This so-called 'hibernation' minimizes the amount of steam, energy and water consumed while waiting for product to enter the system. The ramp up and ramp down time is only about 2 minutes, which makes it worthwhile using hibernation even during short periods of water circulation.

features.name: Target-based production
features.header: Saves time and reduces risk of human error
features.body: This feature enables production of a certain amount of milk and cream – either set as a certain number of litres or programmed to continue until the FMT tank is full (or the source tank is empty). If connected to a separator and standardization unit, it is also possible to define a specific fat content. Operations such as CIP, water circulation and switching to a new recipe can be set up in advance, to be performed automatically in sequence, without the need for human intervention.

features.name: Integrated leakage test
features.body: Before or after production runs, the integrated leakage test lets you pressurize the system to verify that there is no drop in pressure – implying a leak – in the plate heat exchanger or downstream. This is important as a leak could lead to contamination from the pasteurized to the unpasteurized side during production.

features.name: Low-loss balance tank
features.body: A smart balance tank configuration makes it possible to remove the maximum amount of water before product enters the tank, thus reducing the mix of water and product. This method lowers the number of litres in the mix phase by over 50%, leading to a significant reduction in product losses.

features.name: Continuous pressure control
features.body: During production there is normally a pressure differential between the pasteurized and unpasteurized side, to minimise the risk of leakages and keep the product safe from contamination. However, that during discharging (from the separator) this pressure differential usually disappears. In the Tetra Pak® Pasteurizer D, a pressure control system overcomes this problem. It compensates for the pressure dip, thus the avoiding the risk of leakages and contamination.

name: Tetra Pak® Pasteurizer D
header: At the heart of the dairy production process

benefits:
• Product versatility thanks to dynamic stator and double shaft agitator
  • Choice of heating methods enables adaptation to specific products
  • High operational reliability, supported by Tetra Pak’s unique powder valve

features.name: Dynamic stator
features.header: Eliminates the need for multiple tanks
features.body: A dynamic stator in the Turbo Unit – a patented technology from Tetra Pak® - is pneumatically lowered to allow high shear mixing. When raised, the stator enables blending without shear for the addition of larger particles.

features.name: Double shaft agitator
features.header: Enables processing of highly viscous products
features.body: With very viscous products (up to 100 000 cP) uneven mixing can occur. In this unit, a double shaft agitator ensures all the product comes into contact with the high shear head, and is thereby properly mixed.

features.name: Flexible heating methods
features.header: Choose the method to suit your product
features.body: Depending on the application, various heating and cooling systems are available to control product temperature. In applications where ultra fast and gentle product heating is required the Tetra Pak® High Shear Mixer comes with a steam injection system. With the addition of a dimple jacket lining the tank, you can heat and cool especially sensitive products and avoid burn-on of for example proteins.

features.name: Powder valve
features.body: The powder valve is unique to Tetra Pak®'s high shear mixers. It closes immediately if there is a loss of vacuum for any reason. This eliminates the risk of back flow into the powder system, and prevents blockages, which would stop production.

features.name: Choice of dosing systems
features.body: This unit offers the choice of dosing powder ingredients automatically or manually. Automatic dosing works in a controlled and reliable manner. It draws ingredients into the mixer, eliminating the need for an operator. On the other hand, manual dosing is a good solution for price sensitive customers, enabling us to offer a Tetra Pak® High Shear Mixer at a lower investment cost.

name: Tetra Pak® High Shear Mixer - Batch unit

options.name: Pressure vessel
options.body: When heating a product over 100°C and up to 150°C, a pressure vessel is needed to guarantee safety. Tetra Pak® provides pressure vessels for use in conjunction with our High Shear batch mixer, certified according to European PED directive EN97/23EC or U-stamped USA ASME standard.

options.name: Flash cooling
options.body: By adding a plate heat exchanger and a vacuum system to the Tetra Pak® High Shear batch mixer, you can achieve rapid and energy effective cooling of products. Having been pasteurised to kill any microorganisms, products such as soups and sauces can be cooled from 90°C to 50°C in 6 minutes, making them ready for immediate packing.

benefits:
• Excellent product quality since hermetic seals prevent intake of destructive air
  • AirTight technology enables superior separation efficiency
  • Separator designed for unmatched flexibility in both capacity and recipe range

features.name: Hermetic inlet seals
features.body: Outside the unit, the piping is connected to a rotating spindle by hermetic seals. This prevents any air from entering the separator and any product from leaking out. The absence of air in the separation process minimizes the reduction in fat globule size. It enables better separation efficiency at a lower rotation speed and hence lowers energy consumption.

features.name: Hollow spindle
features.body: By contrast to competing separators, in Tetra Pak® Separators the product enters the bowl smoothly and accelerates gradually as it passes through the rotating spindle. This, combined with the absence of air in the system, means the product is handled gently. It also ensures that the size of fat globules and particles is maintained.

features.name: Corrosion resistant bowl
features.body: Thanks to the AirTight technology upon which our Tetra Pak® Separators are based, they offer superior separation efficiency at a lower speed. This enables the use of a steel quality with higher corrosion resistance, which, in turn lengthens the lifetime of the bowl.

features.name: Hermetic outlet seals
features.body: The product exits the separator via hermetic outlet seals. This prevents overflow and the unwanted mixing of skimmed milk and cream. It also prevents unwanted air entering the machine, which could split the fat globules, leading to free fat and possibly also free fatty acids (FFA) as well as product foaming downstream.

features.name: Product discharge pumps
features.header: Enables flexibility and low energy consumption
features.body: The product leaves the separator through two rotating pumps: one for skimmed milk and one for cream. The use of pumps - as opposed to paring discs - makes it possible to run a wide range of capacities in the same machine without any mechanical alterations. It also increases energy efficiency.

name: Tetra Pak® Separators

options.name: Encapt (TM) technology
options.header: Revolutionary energy-saving technology for high-capacity separators
options.body:
By lowering pressure and reducing air friction around the separator bowl, EncaptTM cuts the energy consumption of a Tetra Pak® Separator with AirTight technology by up to 40% compared to other separators.* This improves both operational cost and environmental impact. It is achieved through a combination of a low-pressure pump, discharge pump, water lock and hermetically sealed outlet

*Numbers refer to a production scenario of hot milk skimming at 55 000 l/h including feed and booster pumps.

options.name: INSTAL module
options.body:
The INSTAL module is delivered as an assembled and pre-tested unit ready for production.

Consists of:

  • Stainless-steel frame
  • All peripherals necessary for operations
  • Assembly and pre-testing

options.name: Polynode Disc
options.header: Major breakthrough in separator disc technology enables higher capacity and higher performance.
options.body:
Innovative, one-piece disc construction means the separator can accommodate more discs, increasing separation surface and improving skimming performance. Eliminating traditional welded spacers and replacing them with streamlined, machine-embossed polynodes enables increased stability, higher flow rate and improved performance.

Today, available for hot milk skimming at high capacity – Tetra Pak® Separator H80.

benefits:
• Advanced functionality cuts energy consumption by more than 50% for outstanding savings
  • Very long life due to thermal-stress-eliminating floating protection system
  • 3-A approved with unrivalled food safety thanks to unique welding technology, plus modular design for easy inspection and upgrading
  • added new benefit for testing

features.name: Floating protection system
features.header: Long service lifetime and enhanced food safety
features.body: The inner and outer tubes and the connections in the heat exchanger are floating, not fixed or welded. This allows for thermal expansion or contraction in the tubes without the risk of cracking. It eliminates the risk of product contamination (due to expansion cracking), enables the inspection of all parts, and secures easy exchangeability of parts.

features.name: Modular design
features.header: Flexibility to adapt design to needs
features.body: The frame, tubes and other components parts of the heat exchanger are assembled in such a way as to allow for easy dismantling and rebuilding. This makes it possible to customize the heat exchanger for different recipes, capacities, and to run different products. As a customer, you can choose what to focus on. It's not only about which product you plan to produce; the design also offers flexibility in terms of e.g. energy consumption vs. investment cost.

features.name: Heat exchanger protective panels
features.body: Protective panels built around the Tetra Pak® Tubular Heat Exchanger encapsulate the equipment and contain the heat. This gives up to 6% savings on energy consumption. With added insulation, savings go up to 11%. The panels also increase operator safety since they reduce the risk of contact with hot surfaces.

features.name: Product-to-product heat recovery
features.body: In this type of heat exchanger, product that has already been heated can be run past cold incoming product in order to pre-heat it. This reduces the amount of energy needed to bring the new product up to pasteurization temperature. It is possible thanks to the floating protection system, which eliminates the risks of cracks, and therefore cross contamination of product.

features.name: Long, floating tubes
features.body: Our tubular heat exchangers with 6 meter tubes are the safest on the market. Their floating design makes it possible to offer compact and efficient heat exchangers without any risk of cracks in the tubes. The heat exchangers are extended horizontally, rather than being stacked vertically, which also enables easy access for maintenance.

name: Tetra Pak® Tubular Heat Exchangers

options.name: Spring box
options.header: Enables free product flow and superior hygiene
options.body: An optional patented spring box holds the heat exchanger tubes in place without any need for inner dividers or similar devices. By removing these internal barriers, the spring box facilitates free product flow and eliminates potential hygiene blind spots. The spring box is ideal for products containing fibres, but works well for other applications too.

options.name: Traceability
options.body: Cages are typically sized to hold one vat to maintain vat identity throughout the brining process. This provides you with the ability to collect and record cheese data for improved quality control.

header: With floating protection system for thermal stress absorption

benefits:
• Excellent product quality since hermetic seals prevent intake of destructive air
  • AirTight technology enables superior clarification efficiency
  • Clarifiers designed for unmatched flexibility in both capacity and recipe range

features.name: Hermetic inlet seals
features.header: Superior product clarification and energy efficiency
features.body: Outside the clarifier, the piping is connected to a rotating spindle by hermetic seals. This prevents any air from entering the clarifier and any product from leaking out. The absence of air minimizes the risk of reducing particle and aggregate size. It enables better clarification efficiency at a lower rotation speed and hence lowers energy consumption.

features.name: Hollow spindle
features.body: By contrast to competing models, in Tetra Pak® Clarifiers the product enters the bowl smoothly and accelerates gradually as it passes through the rotating spindle. This, combined with the absence of air in the system, means the product is handled gently. This ensures that the size of particles and aggregates is always maintained.

features.name: Corrosion resistant bowl
features.body: Thanks to the AirTight technology upon which they are based, Tetra Pak® Clarifiers offer a superior clarification efficiency at a lower speed. This enables the use of a steel quality with higher corrosion resistance, which, in turn lengthens the lifetime of the bowl.

features.name: Hermetic outlet seals
features.body: The product exits the clarifier via hermetic outlet seals. This prevents overflow. It also prevents unwanted air entering the machine, which could split the fat globules and cause product foaming downstream.

features.name: Product discharge pump
features.header: Enables flexibility and low energy consumption
features.body: The product leaves the clarifier through a rotating pump. The use of a pump - as opposed to the paring disc - makes it possible to run a wide range of capacities in the same machine without any mechanical alterations. It also increases energy efficiency.

name: Tetra Pak® Clarifiers

options.name: Encapt (TM) technology
options.header: Revolutionary energy-saving technology for high-capacity separators
options.body:
By lowering pressure and reducing air friction around the separator bowl, EncaptTM cuts the energy consumption of a Tetra Pak® Separator with AirTight technology by up to 40% compared to other separators.* This improves both operational cost and environmental impact. It is achieved through a combination of a low-pressure pump, discharge pump, water lock and hermetically sealed outlet

*Numbers refer to a production scenario of hot milk skimming at 55 000 l/h including feed and booster pumps.

options.name: INSTAL module
options.body:
The INSTAL module is delivered as an assembled and pre-tested unit ready for production.

Consists of:

  • Stainless-steel frame
  • All peripherals necessary for operations
  • Assembly and pre-testing

benefits:
• Rapid and reliable production thanks to high shear and energy dissipation rates
  • A completely sealed system (compliant with EHEDG and 3A) ensures food safety
  • Vacuum system consumes 50% less water and 70% less energy than competing models, keeping operational costs in check

features.name: Automated, closed system
features.body:
There is no risk of contamination entering the system since it is completely sealed to maintain product hygiene. In fact, the whole mixer is designed for sanitary execution and can be configured to meet the regulations for both EHEDG and 3A.

Shelf life of the end product is also lengthened by deaeration, since it makes the environment inhospitable for microorganisms.

features.name: Vacuum system
features.body: The vacuum system allows for automatic dosing of powder ingredients in a controlled and reliable manner. It draws ingredients into the mixer, eliminating the need for an operator to do this heavy work. The product is deaerated (i.e. the air is removed from it) enabling higher uptime in the rest of your downstream line. When there is air in the product, this causes burn-on in the downstream equipment, implying a need for more frequent cleaning.

features.name: High shear head
features.header: Enables efficient, fast and repeatable mixing
features.body: This is the heart of the high shear mixer unit. Shear and energy dissipation rates are significantly higher here than in conventional mixing vessels. The mixer is therefore suitable for solid to liquid dispersion, dissolving and emulsification, as well as liquid to liquid homogenization and emulsification. The mixing process is so intense it can even dissolve notoriously difficult ingredients like pectin in seconds.

features.name: Frequency converter
features.body: Once 500 mb has been reached in the tank, a frequency converter fitted to the mixer's vacuum system, regulates the motor to the necessary level. The control system communicates the amount of vacuum (under-pressure) needed at any given step in the process. Whenever the motor slows down, it heats the water (used to seal the vacuum pump) less. The water therefore remains at the correct working temperature for a longer period. This reduces overall water consumption by up to 50% and energy consumption by up to 70%.

features.name: Powder valve
features.body: The powder valve is unique to Tetra Pak®'s high shear mixers. It closes immediately if there is a loss of vacuum for any reason. This eliminates the risk of back flow into the powder system, and prevents blockages, which would stop production.

features.name: Automated level control
features.body: The level control works in combination with the product inlet/outlet to keep the right amount of fluid circulating in the system. If the level gets too high or too low, the load cells and frequency controlled outlet pump return it to the desired level. The amount of powder in the mix also fluctuates during production (be it e.g. sugar, lactose, stabilizers). Regardless of how much powder is entering the mixer, this system maintains steady production.

name: Tetra Pak® High Shear Mixer

options.name: Powder funnels
options.body: For use with your Tetra Pak® High Shear Mixer, funnels are available in sizes 100, 250 l, 350 l and 2000 l. Powders are loaded into the funnels from the top. For the larger models, a platform is required. The powders are then sucked into the mixer in a dense powder phase to minimize air incorporation. The vibrating motor prevents bridging and rat holes during powder intake. The distance between funnel and mixer can be up to 8 metres.

options.name: Drum emptying system
options.body: Ingredients are supplied in drums (buckets, containers or barrels). To empty the drum as thoroughly as possible, a lance is placed inside the drum and used to suck up the ingredient – enabled by the vacuum in the mixer. This prevents the waste of costly ingredients. Once production is complete, the lance is placed in the CIP station and cleaned in the CIP loop together with the Tetra Pak® High Shear Mixer.

benefits:
• HD 100 homgenizing device reduces energy consumption by up to 30% in comparison with conventional designs
  • Easy access to the machine's working parts faciliates supervision, service and maintenance
  • Low cost of spare parts thanks to turnable parts, which can be used twice - once on each side

features.name: HD 100 (homogenizing device)
features.header: Efficient homogenization and low energy consumption
features.body: Compared to conventional homogenizing devices, the disc has a larger diameter and a geometrical design that is optimized for high efficiency. It enables lower pressure and so uses less power, yet it still achieves the same product quality. This reduction in pressure also lowers the total load on the machine and enables longer service intervals.

features.name: Openable hoods, doors, panels
features.body: The homogenizer is designed in such a way as to make the working parts easy to see and access for maintenance and service. For example, the front hood has a lock on each side, which makes it easy to open. Once opened, operators have full access for service of the wet-end parts. Similarly, the drive unit is easily accessed by unlocking the side door, and the hydraulic unit and crankcase are accessed simply by lifting off the two back panels.

features.name: Cooling water pipes
features.body: The pipes for the piston cooling circuit are placed in the cylinder bushing, which means operators do not need to disconnect the cooling water pipes to carry out a service. This saves time and effort, and so contributes to higher uptime.

features.name: Large inspection window
features.header: Easy to inspect; safer for operators
features.body: The hood has a large window, so operators can inspect the homogenizer even while it is running, which increases safety. The moving pistons can also be inspected during operation through the large hood window.

features.name: Turnable parts
features.header: Double the lifetime, half the cost of spare parts
features.body: The homogenizing device, valves and seats are designed symmetrically so they can be used twice – once on each side. This means that when one side gets worn down due to product abrasiveness, the operator simply turns the component over and the machine can run again for just as long on the other side. This simple solution doubles the life of the part and so halves the cost.

features.name: Robust pump block
features.body: In our design, the pumps have fewer penetration holes to improve aseptic conditions. This concept also helps to improve pump block strength. We are the only company who is using pumps for homogenizers made with such rigorous standards and that’s why we can offer a 10-year warranty.

features.name: Proven drive design
features.header: For high capacity at low rpm
features.body: The drive unit is the major working component of a homogenizer. Customers are looking for a machine that can run at a comfortable speed to meet their homogenization needs. Our homogenizer models in the 100 series have motor drives designed to ensure lower wear, longer service intervals and wider safety margins.

name: Tetra Pak® Homogenizer

options.name: HD EnergyIQ
options.body: This patented, pioneering design provides the most energy efficient option for high capacity production of dairy-based products (from 15,000 – 63,600 l/h). It has four to six homogenizing devices working in parallel, which enables a significant pressure reduction (typically 40 bar) while achieving the same product quality.

options.name: Automatic damper
options.body: Homogenizer dampers absorb pressure variation and shocks before and after the homogenizer. Automatic air refill maintains the air cushion in the homogenizer damper to ensure smooth operation. Without the air cushion, vibration and cavitation would occur and shorten the running time. Fully automated CIP is included - increasing operator safety, improving hygiene, and further optimizing the production cycle.

options.name: Smart automation system
options.header: Gives you full control of homogenization
options.body: Our homogenizers have automation embedded into their design and the automation is becoming more and more advanced. Smart automation gives you a PLC/HMI that is easily accessible via a tablet or PC and allows you to do such things as change a recipe or working parameter at the press of a button on the screen.

options.name: Removable modular design
options.header: Fast service and easy access cut downtime
options.body: Tetra Pak® is the first company to introduce the concept of removable modules for homogenizers. For example, the hydraulic unit is fully removable on our latest models. If something goes wrong, you can easily take away the entire hydraulic module and put a new one onto the machine. In this way, you can soon restart production.

header: Pioneering design for lower pressure and energy savings

benefits:
• Provides gentle, energy efficient heating, optimized to maintain product quality
  • Easy to clean, service and maintain, and can even be rebuilt for new applications or different capacities
  • Long equipment lifetime thanks to the robustness of gaskets and plate pressing technology.

features.name: Clip-on gaskets
features.header: Safe, quick and easy to dismantle for service
features.body: Gaskets are used to tighten the plates of the heat exchangers. Tetra Pak®'s clip-on gaskets have robust T-clip design, and are easy to remove and reassemble. They also have specific features to enhance safety, such as a safety groove in the seal chamber. Should a leakage occur anywhere on the gasket, it is visible from the outside of the unit, thereby preventing the risk of cross contamination between product and media.

features.name: Bolted connections
features.body: The connections in Tetra Pak®'s Plate Heat Exchangers are bolted rather than welded to the connection plates, which make it easy to adapt and rebuild units for different capacities and products.

features.name: Plate geometry
features.header: Gentle food processing and easy cleaning
features.body: The tall and narrow shape of the heat exchangers' plates, the surface pattern, and the size of the portholes where the product enters are all specially designed for food processing. Together they enable an even product flow, an even product distribution over the entire plate and an efficient, even heat transfer. This design has no low-velocity areas, which reduces fouling and thus enables longer production runs. Even flow rates also make cleaning more effective, and therefore faster.

name: Tetra Pak® Plate Heat Exchanger
header: Durable design with plate geometry optimized for food applications

benefits:
• Excellent product quality since hermetic seals prevent intake of destructive air
  • AirTight technology enables superior spore and bacteria removal efficiency
  • Bactofuge units designed for unmatched flexibility in both capacity and recipe range

features.name: Hermetic inlet seals
features.header: Superior spore and bacteria removal and energy efficiency
features.body: Outside the unit, the piping is connected to a rotating spindle by hermetic seals. This prevents any air from entering the Bactofuge unit and any product from leaking out. The absence of air minimizes the risk of particle and aggregate size being reduced. It enables better spore and bacteria removal efficiency at a lower rotation speed and hence lowers energy consumption.

features.name: Hollow spindle
features.body: By contrast to competing models, in Tetra Pak® Bactofuge units the product enters the bowl smoothly and accelerates gradually as it passes through the rotating spindle. This, combined with the absence of air in the system, means the product is handled gently. This ensures that the size of particles and aggregates is always maintained.

features.name: Corrosion resistant bowl
features.body: Thanks to the AirTight technology upon which our Bactofuge units are based, they offer a superior spore and bacteria removal efficiency at a lower speed. This enables the use of a steel quality with higher corrosion resistance, which, in turn lengthens the lifetime of the bowl.

features.name: Hermetic outlet seals
features.body: The product exits the Bactofuge unit via hermetic outlet seals. This prevents overflow and, depending on the model, the unwanted mixing of the clean milk with the spore and bacteria enriched milk. It also prevents unwanted air entering the machine, which could split the fat globules and cause product foaming downstream.

features.name: Product discharge pumps
features.header: Enables flexibility and low energy consumption
features.body: The product leaves the Bactofuge unit through one or two rotating pumps, depending on model. The use of pumps - as opposed to the paring discs - makes it possible to run a wide range of capacities in the same machine without any mechanical alterations. It also increases energy efficiency.

name: Tetra Pak® Bactofuge unit

options.name: Encapt (TM) technology
options.header: Revolutionary energy-saving technology for high-capacity separators
options.body:
By lowering pressure and reducing air friction around the separator bowl, EncaptTM cuts the energy consumption of a Tetra Pak® Separator with AirTight technology by up to 40% compared to other separators.* This improves both operational cost and environmental impact. It is achieved through a combination of a low-pressure pump, discharge pump, water lock and hermetically sealed outlet

*Numbers refer to a production scenario of hot milk skimming at 55 000 l/h including feed and booster pumps.

options.name: INSTAL module
options.body:
The INSTAL module is delivered as an assembled and pre-tested unit ready for production.

Consists of:

  • Stainless-steel frame
  • All peripherals necessary for operations
  • Assembly and pre-testing

header: Units for removal of spores and bacteria

benefits:
• Simple and modular – easy to install and use with premium performance
    • Cost effective – enable economical use of water and detergents
    • Flexible – adapt cleaning programs or create your own to meet specific production needs

features.name: Liquid tracking with virtual imaging
features.header: Prevents detergent waste and saves time
features.body: Tetra Pak® CIP unit P creates a virtual image of each cleaning circuit. This, combined with a liquid tracking system, keeps track of the different cleaning phases. The unit 'knows' when the mix of detergent and water reaches the part of the machine where it should be separated into its different parts again. Knowing where all the liquids are enables accurate recovery to the right tank. This minimizes the dilution of stored detergent, as well as reducing waste (i.e. flushing detergent down the drain).

features.name: Water plug
features.header: Minimises water consumption and saves time
features.body: The CIP unit's automation system enables full control of all the liquid in the cleaning circuit. The 3 standard cleaning phases are caustic, water (which flushes out the caustic) then acid. Liquid tracking makes it possible to separate the caustic and acid phases with a water plug instead of a full rinse. This minimises water consumption and reducing waiting time before starting the acid phase.

features.name: Flexible dosing system
features.header: Lets you vary the cleaning according to need
features.body: The length of time and the concentration of detergent required to clean the equipment varies according to the product that has been processed on it. This CIP unit can for instance, be set up with dosing of concentrates directly into the pressure line - either to be used for 'single use' (detergent is only used once) or to mix detergent with water in the detergent tank (if using the same detergent repeatedly). During cleaning, dips in detergent concentration are compensated with an automatic boost of concentrate, if necessary.

features.name: Conductivity management
features.body: The system measures both the temperature and conductivity of the cleaning fluids in the circuit in order to understand which liquid is present and how concentrated it is. If the system does not have the right concentration of liquid, more detergent concentrate is added. When using other formulations besides caustic soda and acid, it is possible to add the correct/relevant temperature coefficients in the HMI.

features.name: CIP programme management
features.header: Lets you devise your own cleaning programmes
features.body: There are fourteen standard cleaning programmes. However, it is also possible to add new cleaning programmes if needed. This is useful when switching to new production equipment with special cleaning needs, or switching from one product to another. You can adapt to the precise need easily as it is part of the standard interface. A trained engineer from Tetra Pak® can support if necessary.

name: Tetra Pak® CIP unit P

benefits:
• Reliable performance and uniform product quality
  • Minimize cream giveaway with world-class precision
  • Unlimited capabilities to meet your specific needs

features.name: Multiple ingredients lines
features.header: Enables production of numerous dairy products
features.body: Additional ingredient lines can be connected to the standardizer, making this unit ideal for use in multi-product processing. A whole series of formulated dairy products are possible.

features.name: Multiple component standardization
features.body: Tetra Pak® Standardization unit has a unique ability to standardize not only fat content but also solids-non-fat, total solids and protein, thanks to built-in software which regulates the mass balance. This feature is valuable when making cheese milk, for example, since the ratio of fat and protein entering the cheese vats has to be highly controlled in order to achieve consistent product quality.

features.name: Advanced software
features.body: High performance measuring instruments send signals to a powerful computer, which rapidly makes calculations and instructs the regulation valve to fine-tune fat content. It enables an extremely precise result with negligible cream give-away, thus leading to significant savings. For example, over one year, achieving a fat content precision +/- 0,015 % producers can save €183 750 per year.

name: Tetra Pak® Standardization unit

options.name: SpotOn technology
options.body: Controlling standardization all the way from the pasteurizer's balance tank to the final product tank (prior to the filling machine), SpotOn technology makes your product composition even more accurate. The self-cleaning separator discharges typically every 45 minutes, causing the normal balance of fat in the product to be disturbed. SpotOn software compensates instantly and automatically for this disturbance, readjusting the fat content to the correct level. It also enables product changes on the fly, which adds to efficiency and saves time and product losses.

options.name: TETRA PAK® STANDARDIZATION UNIT WITH CONTINUOUS PROTEIN CONTROL
options.header: Continuous, accurate control of protein and fat.
options.body: Integrating FOSS MilkoStream with the Tetra Pak Standardization unit via our proprietary software results in a unique, true in-line solution. It is the only solution for the continuous, accurate measurement and control of protein and fat; and guaranteed method for protein control and performance ratios. It provides 500 real-time results per hour for protein and fat measurements, enabling fast, continuous reaction to data. Human error and uncertainty are virtually eliminated in sampling, delivering improved efficiency and product quality.

benefits:
• Provides safe storage between processing and packaging, which minimizes product losses
  • Cleaning in place and production monitoring enhance efficiency
  • Can be customized with e.g. agitators and cooling jacket, to further increase safety and quality

features.name: Agitators
features.body: Tetra Pak® Aseptic Tank can be fitted with different types of agitators that stir the product continuously to ensure a homogenous consistency. Producers can choose between top-mounted agitators placed in the middle (or off centre) of the tank's interior, or magnetic agitators placed at the bottom.

features.name: Low fouling end valve cluster
features.header: Prevents burnt particles entering the product
features.body: An end valve cluster prevents fouling in the pipes and so safeguards product taste and consistency, especially with ESL products. The longer the product runs, the greater the risk of fouling and, therefore, the more vital this feature is.

features.name: Overpressure with sterile air
features.header: Stops contamination from outside the tank
features.body: Thanks to sterile air over-pressure in the tank, no external substances can enter and contaminate the product.

features.name: Independent cleaning
features.body: The combination of an intermediate steam barrier (ISB) and high volume tank (optional) means you can clean the Tetra Pak® Aseptic Tank tank separately from the UHT unit. When the tank is filled, the processing unit can be cleaned and prepared for a new production run, thus eliminating the need to stop the line.

features.name: Safety rail and ladder
features.body: A frame built around the ladder ensures the safety of operators climbing up the side of large tanks. An additional circular safety rail prevents accidents when operators are working on top of the tank.

name: Tetra Pak® Aseptic Tank

options.name: Extended Shelf Life
options.body: When making products with an extended shelf life, Tetra Pak® Aseptic Tank LV can be fitted with a continuous circular configuration. This enables products to continue to circulate under refrigerated conditions in the event of an unplanned stoppage. Thanks to constant temperature control, the risk of bacterial growth is eliminated, and product quality is preserved between processing and packaging.

options.name: Tetra Pak® Aseptic Tank LV
options.body:
The LV model can be used for a wide range of applications and is best suited for low to medium viscosity products with smaller particles and fibres. This vertical tank has a cylindrical cooling jacket, manhole, CIP nozzles and safety rail.

Capacity: Wide range of tank sizes

options.name: Tetra Pak® Aseptic Tank HV
options.body:
The HV model can be used for a wide range of applications and is best suited for medium to high viscosity products without particles or with only small particles that do not separate out and form a sediment. This vertical tank has a cylindrical cooling jacket, manhole, CIP nozzles and safety rail.

Capacity: Wide range of tank sizes

options.name: Tetra Pak® Aseptic Tank HH
options.body:
The HH model is designed to be used for both high and low viscosity aseptically processed food products with or without particles. The maximum particle size is 18 mm. This model is equipped with a low-speed horizontal agitator keeping the entire product in motion in a gentle way. This horizontal tank has a cooling jacket, paddle agitator and CIP nozzles.

Capacity: Wide range of tank sizes

header: Buffering tanks that keep product and people safe

benefits:
• Extreme product flexibility. Simply switch to a different bag of added ingredients
  • High precision dosing which prevents waste of costly ingedients and ensures uniform product quality
  • Saves time and resources when developing new products, since complexity is reduced and there is no need to make process adjutsments

features.name: High precision dosing
features.body: To ensure exactly the right amount of added ingredients are injected into the base product, a weighing system monitors the added ingredients and flow transmitters monitor the amount of base product as they enter the filling machine. Accuracy is further enhanced by use of hoses of different diameters adapted to specific recipes.

features.name: ‘Just in time’ production
features.body: According to the 'Just in time' production method, the dosing unit is positioned just before the filling machine. Ingredients are dosed at the last minute before packaging. It is extremely quick and simple to switch from one added ingredient to another. All the operator has to do is change the ingredient bag in the dosing unit (and the packaging material in the filling machine).

features.name: Ingredient injection
features.header: Reduces cleaning needs; saves production time
features.body: Since the dosed ingredients do not come into contact with any of the upstream processing equipment there is no need for intermediate cleaning in place between production runs with different products. Energy and detergent consumption is therefore also reduced.

features.name: Closed ingredients system
features.header: Flexible and safe in-line ingredient delivery
features.body: The ingredients to be dosed are packed separately in advance, and quality checked before being sent to your production plant in ready-to-use 5 or 10 litre aseptic bags. When dosing, the closed ingredient package is connected to the product line via an aseptic transfer hose.

features.name: Recipe management system
features.body: Operators scan the barcode on the ingredients and the hose kit, and the recipe management system confirms that they are the right ones to use for a given product. All the data is stored so that it can be analysed in case of an issue.

features.name: Product quality control
features.body: In the production of UHT lactose reduced milk, aseptic dosing means less lactase is added to the product, and this in turn means less sugar content in the milk. Less sugar content reduces the browning of the milk(caused by the Maillard reaction) and it typically doubles product shelf life from 3 to 6 months.

name: Tetra Pak® Aseptic Dosing unit F
header: Advanced technology for the ultimate in aseptic dosing flexibility

benefits:
• One process step is removed when going from batch to inline dosing, thereby reducing equipment and running costs.
  • Ingredients savings - since dosing takes place after heating it eliminates the need for overdosing
  • Excellent quality end product thanks to low heat load, high dosing precision and repeatability

features.name: Aseptic inline dosing
features.body: In this system, the ingredients are aseptically treated prior to dosing. This means they do not require heating. Any costly ingredients therefore maintain their original properties, which means smaller quantities of ingredient are needed to get the same result.

features.name: Product quality control
features.body: In the production of UHT lactose reduced milk, aseptic dosing means less lactase is added to the product, and this in turn means less sugar content in the milk. Less sugar content reduces the browning of the milk(caused by the Maillard reaction) and it typically doubles product shelf life from 3 to 6 months.

features.name: Expert dosing service
features.body: With two decades experience accumulated experience, Tetra Pak®'s aseptic dosing specialists can help you evaluate the suitability of ingredients (type and quality) and provide guidelines regarding the correct filter for each application. At certain of Tetra Pak®'s Product Development Centres a Tetra Pak® Aseptic Dosing unit E is installed for product trials.

features.name: Filter supervision and control system
features.body: A self-supervising system controls the pressure and temperature of the filters in order to safeguard aseptic conditions (and filter running time). It is equipped with a monitoring system to ensure that the sterile filter is intact after the sterilization phase and ready for production.

name: Tetra Pak® Aseptic Dosing unit E
